Question: How bad can occasional smoking be to a womans health
Answer: Occasional light or social smoking though not as regular smoking still has attendant risks for anyone engaging in it Yes the risks are lower compared to regular smokers but it is still there risks of heart disease lung disease and other cancers women are not exempt and women who are occasional smokers are susceptible to this too  There is also the problem of people thinking they are occasional smokers but not knowing they are taking too much to just be occasional smokers  Smoking generally has no overall benefits its best avoided  Even people who are around smokers are at risk  It is best for us to shun smoking in any form or level of occurrence

Question: All of a sudden I have been having episodes of panic attacks who can help me understand the cause and how to prevent them
Answer:
First off it is completely natural to panic when you find yourself in a situation that is dangerous or stressful But if you find yourself panicking frequently for no apparent reason then you might be suffering from a panic disorder 

Panic attacks are sometimes triggered by certain memories or events in your life Other times they can happen spontaneously without any trigger So to understand the cause you need to try and remember if you had any specific thoughts or experienced certain things before your previous panic episodes occurred 

As for treatment firstly you need to understand that panic attacks are not life threatening meaning that you are not likely to die or be physically harmed from having a panic attack So relax 

The next time you have a panic attack do the following 

1 Stay where you are 
2 Breathe in and out deeply and slowly
3 Remind yourself that it is just another panic attack and it will be over in a few minutes 

Panic attacks usually resolve on their own within 5  20 minutes 

However if your panic attacks are so frequent that they prevent you from having a normal day at work or at home then you need to visit a psychologist The psychologist may ask you to perform some exercises on a regualr basis and may also prescribe some medications to help 

Overall you should be fine eventually

Question: What could actually be the cause of a delay in menstrual period
Answer:
Hello

There are a number of reasons why your period could be delayed and you didnt give us information as to how long it has been delayed for

A number of people have irregular periods so its hard to predict the onset

Assuming you arent Pregnant Anxiety could delay the periods
Use of contraceptives could also mess with the cycle
Infections and Significant Lifestyle changes Fasting Intense Physical activity Significant weight losscould delay your periods too

Question: What do you test for to know of you have sti
Answer:
Hi The symptoms of an STI differ in men and women  We use symptoms to identify the cause of the STI and tests to confirm Generally we test fluids from the genital organs to identify an STI 
In men 
urethral swabs are taken from within the tip of the penis 
discharge of the penis can be tested as well
Sometimes the urine may be tested for STI like Clamydia and blood tests can identify HIV as well as mouth swabs  
For homosexuals swabs from the anus may be used 
In women
Pelvic tests  taking swabs from the vagina and inner lining of the womb are used

Question: Hello I was diagnosed with glaucoma I have been on optimol eyedrops for over a year to regulate fluid pressure Is there any process of gaining better eye sight or will it continuously deteriorate
Answer:
Hello
Glaucoma means increased pressure in the eye Eye drops such as Optimol aim to decrease the pressure in the eyes to keep them at a normal level and prevent further detoriation of the sight
Sadly vision loss from Glaucoma cant be restored so the eye drops are there to maintain the pressure and ensure that there is no further loss
So attempt to be regular with the drops and regular checkup to make sure there is no worsening

Question: Hello I did an RVS test and it came out negative what is rvs test and how reliable is it

Hi RVS means Retroviral Screening it is just a name for tests that are done to check if someone has HIV or not A negative result means that the test method used cant detect HIV in your blood There are different types of kits used in this regard You should go back for a retest at least every 6 months to be sure of yout status The tests are reliable for the next 3 months as they are especially the ones that give you a result rapidly

Question:
Hello  Ive been feeling pains on my left testicle for over a year now The pain is now extended to the groin area of my body I also simultaneously feel pains on my left leg from my knee downwards and also on my left hand And sometimes also have headache on the left part of my head Let me just say i feel pains on the left part of my body anytime this testicular pain arises

I had a test last year and the result says i have Bilateral Testicular Microlithasis with Mild Hydrocele Can you tell me what that means and the way forward
Answer:
Testicular microlithiasis is usually detected by ultrasound scans and they are in most cases painless People with such conditions are advised to regularly self examine their testes and to do routine scans in order to ensure no further complications arise As for the hydrocele this is the accumulation of fluids around a testicle which makes the scrotum feel heavier This too is often painless and when pain is felt is it most likely more severe 
As for the next steps it will be in your best interest to get a full examination by a primary care doctor who will then refer you to a urologist for an individualized specialist treatment

Question:
My 5 month old baby now likes to put everything in her mouth from 3 fingers to pulling my hands and putting it in her mouth TV remote and the likes I recently bought some silicon teeter she dosnt like it cause its too wide  

1 Any reason why she loves putting stuffs in her mouth
2 Any recommendation on what I can get for her
Answer:
During teething the babys teeth starts to break through the gums causing tender and swollen gums and general irritability for the child Therefore the child tends to place objects or fingers into the mouth in an attempt to reduce discomfort It is important that you try ensure a clean environment and particularly clean hands

Pacifiers and teething rings are said to help the child However if the child is in visible and prolonged discomfort please visit your doctor

Question:
I have an irregular menstrual cycle I get my periods after 2631 days The time frame varies every month How can I determine my ovulation day

Thank you
Answer:
A Cycle length of 2135 days is considered regular however because of the varying lengths you have it will be harder to calculate your specific ovulatory window
An easier way to calculate it is to subtract 14 days from your cycle length Ie if its 35 days you ovulate on day 21 Also allow for 2 days before and after as your unsafe period
Be sure to also look out for other physical signs of ovulation such as an increase in body basal temperature and changes in cervical mucus consistency
Lastly there are several period tracking apps available which can help you with more accurate tracking

Question:
A couple of weeks back I was diagnosed with submucosal anterior leiomyoma measuring 362cm  362cm 

I would like to know if there is a rate at which it grows Should I expect it to have doubled in size by the end of the year for instance

I would also like to know how high my chances of infertility or miscarriages

Can I adopt any contraceptive method to slow its growth

I am a 23yearold and I may not be married until the next 2 years Is this timeframe safe for me


Thank you

Concerned Female
Answer:
Hi it is usually said that most women If not all have fibroids They just vary in sizes and the level of issues they give  So its not a a huge worry to find a fibroid except it is adversely affecting ones health

1 No one can predict the rate at which they grow at times they regress on their own at times they maintain the same size due to different reasons 

2 Having fibroid is not equal to infertility except in a few cases so I would say that you technically have nothing to worry about with respect to infertility It also doesnt equal to having miscarriages it does cause it at times but its not a surety

3 If you are worried about the size or have any symptoms from it you can have it removed to give you rest if mind but asides that you dont have to worry or stress yourself about it 

People with fibroids get pregnant carry it to term and have babies without any issues 
You can see a Surgeon for a more definitive management 

Thanks

Question: What could regular pain in the right side close to the centre of chest mean Especially when its cold or after running or walking fast over a distance
Answer: Hi based on what you have explained the pain might be due to an inflammation of the bones of the rib this is usually worsened by cold and exercise at times It also happens in people who exercise frequently especially those who lift weights A good salve is to apply Neurogesic topical cream to the area Cover the chest adequately in cold weather These should help mitigate the pain If any of these dont work then a physical evaluation by a doctor is essential

Question: What could regular pain in the right side close to the centre of chest mean Especially when its cold or after running or walking fast over a distance
Answer:
Hi just to share my personal experience 
I had similar pain last year I was exposed to very cold weather conditions for a number of years plus excessive lifting of heavy objects I went to the hospital for diagnoses I did Xray Chest Ultrasound and blood sample tests The tests returned negative so I was placed on pain relieving tablets but I didnt feel better 

I consulted another physician who recommended antibiotics and that I should avoid extreme rigorous exercises such as weight lifting and these two resolved the whole pain so I agree with Dr Ayomide that cold and physical exercise could aggravate it I suspect my own case was mild pain to inflammation maybe caused by bacteria so that was why antibiotics was recommended for me

I hope this helps in a way

Question:
HiI have two questionsthe first is thatI notice dat Water comes out of my nipplesnot like in a rush ojust when been pressed and allI am not marriednever given birth neither am I pregnantwhat could probably be the causeis my prolactin high or something
Then the second question is I havent been able to have sexlike the dick wont just enter I actually thought it was the size of the dickbut den I even tried the smallest of all dicks it didntits wlwa so painful and I couldnt endureeven when I drank alcohol and got drunk so my mind wont be dereI still felt d pain after he tried penetratingand am no Virgin but I havent had sex in a long time just because of displs what do I doi need to save my relationship
Answer:
This sounds like vaginismus and could be as a  result of emotional factors medical factors or both

Vaginismus is when the pelvic floor muscles spasms involuntary resulting in painful difficult and often impossible to have sexual intercourse to undergo a gynecological exam or to insert a tampon

Besides sex do you also feel pain during tampon insertion or during a gynecological examination 

Emotional causes of vaginismus include fear of anticipated pain anxiety about performance or guilt traumatic experiences Insufficient vaginal lubrication UTI or yeast infection are some physical conditions that might cause vaginismus 

Diagnosis  treatment is possible but varies depending on the underlying cause You will benefit from seeing a doctor who will take a full medical history and carry out a pelvic examination Treatment modalities include but are not limited to pelvic floor control exercises counselling and some form of insertion training

Question:

Answer:

Wherever you choose to spread underwear just ensure that it is well dry before use

Question: I have an itch around my right butt and thigh Its been the case for over five years Ive run tests for STDs they say I have none Worried About to be sexually active Can I pass this thing to my partner What can I do
Answer:
Five years is a long time to have an itch without knowing the cause 
What triggers or worsens the itch Maybe when you eat or drink something in particular or when you come in contact with something if thats the case you might have some form of allergies 
Whats your skincare regimen like Do you generally have dry skin If yes you should consider using a generous amount of moisturizer immediately after taking your bath especially while your skin is still damp drink lots of fluids to stay hydrated You might also consider changing you soap to a milder soap and improve you general hygiene and also around the area 
What is the skin around the area like Is there any rash or unusual skin changes A rash if present is most likely on account of a recurrent infection A visit to your doctor or a specialist dermatologist will definitely be helpful in ruling out other conditions like eczema or atopic dermatitis which are some other skin conditions that might cause itchy skin

Question: Have been having this pain under my abdomen  it happens once in a while and makes me uncomfortable and when it happens i tend not to walk well I have been treated for ulcer years back but i dont know what is the cause of this
Answer:
Causes of lower abdomen pain are varied The pain may be negligible or could be a sign of something ominous or quite serious 
In cases of recurrent pain in the lower abdomen it is important to get checked to exclude serious issues 

It is highly unlikely that the stomach gastric ulcers are the reasons for pain in lower abdominal area Gastric ulcers are usually located higher above or around the navel 

More information is required to know what is the cause of this pain Are you male or female How old are you Have you had any surgery in the past How would you describe the pain When do you feel it  at rest or while doing something light or heavy exercises When you are hungry or after you eat 

I believe these are some of the questions your physician will ask and the answers plus physical therapy examination  medical tests will help to provide a diagnosis and a treatment plan

Question: Hello doc can u please prescribe medications for PCOS and high Prolactin for a trying to conceive woman Thanks
Answer:
Hello 

Treatment for  PCOS is mostly individualised because symptoms vary from woman to woman and oftentimes the treatment is based on the symptoms that you might have and show Symptoms such irregular period excessive hair acne or obesity might show in varying amounts and treatment often involves lifestyle changes orand medication depending on the symptoms 

Due to the high levels of male hormones that prevent the release of an egg in women with PCOS it might be a little harder to get pregnant However a regular physical examination and management with a gynaecologist or fertility expert plus lifestyle changes like healthy eating exercise monitoring ovulation and timing sexual intercourse plus the use of prescribed medications will improve your chances of having a successful pregnancy

Question: Doc my period used to last for 5day and later reduced to 4days and 3days and now it lasts for only 2days Can i still get pregnant
Answer:
Hello

Thanks for posting your question 

Sometimes women experience fluctuations in their menstrual flow and it also varies from one woman to another Most doctors will tell you the regular flow lasts 37 days However some will tell you 2 days could be normal Some factors like stress weight changes hormonal issues contraceptives medications etc could affect your cycle

Are you taking any form of contraceptives are you on any long term medications Whats your mental state like and any changes in your weight

Do well to visit your gynaecologist for a thorough examination

As regards getting pregnant that depends on if youre producing an egg during your cycle amongst other factors including your partners sperm quality It takes two to achieve a pregnancy

Your doctor should be able to assess you and your partner and perform the necessary tests to ensure that youre healthy and good to go

Hope this helps Cheers

Question: What products can I use for Vaginal health
Answer:
Here are some tips on how to maintain a healthy vagina 

1 Always wipe front to back
2 Dont use any special scrubs they can alter your pH and cause irritation Just soap and water for your vulva is all you really need Leave your vagina alone
3 Allow your vulva breathe therefore ensure to reduce sweat around the vulva as this can lead to a yeast infection Clean cotton underwear is often the best choice
4 Water based lubricants only
5 Be sexually responsible Use condoms if not in a mutually monogamous relationship Get tested for STIs regularly
6 Speak to your doctor about available vaccines eg for HPV or contraceptive options
7 You might benefit from regular check up with your gynaecologist

However should you notice any of the following go and see a doctor

 A change in the color odor or amount of vaginal discharge
 Vaginal redness  itching
 Vaginal bleeding between periods after sex or post menopause
 A growth or bulge in your vagina
 Pain during intercourse

Question: What is the likelihood of me getting pregnant on the first day of my period having unprotected sex when my ovulation is in 7 days
Answer:
Your menstrual cycle begins on the first day of your period and continues up to the first day of your next period
A woman is most fertile during her ovulation period usually days 12  14 before your next period starts

To answer your question although it is quite unlikely to get pregnant on the first day of your period it CAN still happen Sperm cells can survive for days in the body thus increasing your chances of getting pregnant especially if you have a short cycle or ovulate early 7 days is early yes 

Please note that if you have sex without using contraception you can get pregnant at any time during your menstrual cycle even during or just after your period Theres no safe time of the month Every time you have unprotected sex there are varying risks of becoming pregnant or contracting a sexually transmitted infection 

Why dont you speak to your physician about other forms of contraception

Question: What are the causes of vaginitis bacteria and how can it be cured
Answer:
Good morning
Vaginitis is a term used to describe vaginal inflammation or infection characterised by itching foulsmelling discharge and sometimes pain Number of factors have been known to cause this and these include imbalance in vaginal normal flora bacterial infection and oestrogen depletion in post menopausal women
The vagina has its own resident microorganisms normal flora which perform protective roles in the vagina Once these organisms are depleted due to some unhealthy practices like douching washing inside of the vagina with soap usage of vaginal spray etcother harmful bacteria can then begin to multiply in the vagina leading to infection
These bacteria can also invade the vagina in cases relating to immunosuppression
It is advisable that any female with symptoms of vaginitis visit a doctor who can further examine and run some tests to know the exact organisms implicated and as such prescribe the appropriate medication to CURE the condition
Thank you

Answer:

Im sorry about the stress youve had so far with contraceptives
Hormonal contraceptives can cause weight gain and progesteroneonly implants are notorious for causing menstrual irregularities
If you use combined oral contraceptives your menstrual cycle will be regular but you may still gain weight Also note that you have to take the pills everyday at a regular time
You could also use a nonhormonal intrauterine contraceptive device like Copper IUCD which wont make you gain weight or cause menstrual irregularities but it may cause heavy menstrual flow
There are barrier methods that you could use too in form of female condom or cervical cap You could also use spermicidal creams
Kindly visit the family planning clinic for any of these options that will be suitable for you
I hope this is helpful
Best wishes

Question:
Hi Wellvis
I will like to know how people catch Hepatitis what to do to avoid catching it
Answer:
Hepatitis is inflammation of the liver Viruses are the most common cause but other infections toxic substances eg alcohol certain drugs and autoimmune diseases can also cause it It can be selflimiting or can progress to fibrosis cirrhosis or liver cancer Many more people dont even know that they have hepatitis

There are 5 main hepatitis viruses referred to as types A B C D and E

A and E are typically caused by consumption of contaminated food or water 

B and C lead to chronic disease in hundreds of millions of people and together are the most common cause of liver cirrhosis and cancer
B C and D usually occur as a result of parenteral contact with infected body fluids Common ways of catching these viruses include receipt of contaminated blood or blood products invasive medical procedures using contaminated equipment and for hepatitis B transmission from mother to baby at birth from family membersdomestic help to child and also by sexual contact

Acute infection may occur with limited or no symptoms or may include symptoms such as jaundice yellowing of the skin and eyes dark urine extreme fatigue nausea vomiting and abdominal pain

Treatment options are determined by which type of hepatitis you have and whether the infection is acute or chronic

WAYS TO PREVENT HEPATITIS
1 Practicing good hygiene especially with how you prepare what you eat and drink or get them from 

2 Hepatitis B C and D contracted through contaminated blood can be prevented by not sharing needles razors someone elses toothbrush not touching spilled blood 
Hepatitis B and C can also be contracted through sexual intercourse and intimate sexual contact Practicing safe sex by using condoms and dental dams can help decrease the risk of infection

3 Vaccinations are available to prevent the development of hepatitis A and B

Question:
Hello I completed my hepatitis vaccine in 2008 and was told to have a repeat 10 years after as the immunity in my blood has dropped 
I asked a few doctors if taking a booster means taking one dose or the whole 3 course but never got a certain answer My spouse is positive 
What can I do  Regarding vaccination 
Thank you
Answer:
Booster doses of hepatitis B vaccine extends the effectiveness of the vaccine They are usually not recommended for most healthy people but the need for booster doses is determined by a certain blood test that looks for hepatitis B surface antibody 

However on account of the positive status of spouse and exposure to the disease you should get a booster dose or at least consider it after getting a test done  

Please note that booster dose of hepatitis B vaccine is not harmful

Question: I want to know about dominant HBV What are its symptoms and effect
Answer:
Hello Good afternoon 

I dont quite get your question 

Wen we about dominancy in hepatitis it refers to a condition where someone can be infected with both viruses B and C but one of them is more dominant in the system and suppresses the other 

As regards the symptoms of hepatitis they are pretty much the same  
Jaundice Your skin or the whites of the eyes turn yellow and your pee turns brown or orange
Lightcolored poop
Fever
Fatigue that persists for weeks or months
Stomach trouble like loss of appetite nausea and vomiting
Belly pain

However it is good to know that all these symptoms may not be present at the same time if you  see any one especially the jaundice  please go and see the doctor 

I hope this helps

Question: I need a detailed explanation of HBV please
Answer:
Hepatitis B is one of the virsues that cause Hepatitis it is the commonest amongst them especially in Nigeria 
It is spread through body fluids sexual contact blood transfusion sharing of sharps etc
The great thing about it is that it is preventable by vaccination which confers significant immunity against it 
Also out of the people that get infected by it a major percentage recover and get it cleared 
It is one of the commonest causes of Chronic Liver Disease It can be treated and kept from causing damage to the Liver 

Get tested today to know your status To also prevent it observe safe sexual practices Dont share sharps

Question: Please wellvis can someone have a vagina infection when you he comes in contact with his partner who is in infected
Answer:
Hello Mark 

I do not completely understand your question However I will use this opportunity to talk about STIs and I hope I address your concern 

Sexually transmitted infections STIs are infections that can be caught or passed on when you have UNPROTECTED sex or close sexual contact with another person who already has an STI
Using a condom during sex is the best way to avoid STIs including HIV if you cannot abstain 
Also reducing the number of sexual partners also means youre less likely to get infected

If you suspect you have an STIs please go and see a doctor because symptoms vary from person to person and if you have been diagnosed with an STI let your sexual partners know and encourage them to get tested and treated too 

There are many different STIs and there are many signs and symptoms that mean you may have gotten one but sometimes there are no signs at all When STIs do produce symptoms they usually develop around the penis or vagina Your sexual partners may also experience symptoms

Generally the symptoms of STIs can include 
 unusual andor smelly discharge from the penis vagina or anus
 pain during urination
 sores blisters ulcers warts or rashes in the genital area
 pain in the scrotum or testicles
 lumps and bumps on the genitals

You can visit a General Hospital around you for check up and treatment

Question: kindly help me what kind of disease where one urinate blood and the penis itches
Answer:
What other symptoms do you have Pain in your sides Do you have a family history of kidney stones or any other kidney diseases Are you on any medication and has this happened before 

Having blood in your urine is known medically as hematuria it can be a sign that something is wrong with your kidneys or another part of your urinary tract 

Based on the associated penis itch I think you might have a Sexually Transmitted Infection Other possible diagnosis are Urinary tract infections kidney infections or stone Depending on your age it might also be due to an enlarged prostate A blow or other injury to your kidneys from an accident or contact sports or strenuous exercise can also cause visible blood in your urine 

Without physical examination and lab tests I am unable to give an accurate diagnosis You will benefit from visiting a doctor who will examine you to find the exact cause and subsequently treat you based on the findings

Question: Good evening please what does it mean to have a watery discharge a day after sex or the day of the sex till the next I have checked online the meaning but I cant place my finger on the color of the dischargeAnd if during sex the condom is in you Vagina after he has released but you removed the condom can it lead to pregnancy
Answer:
Discharge post sex is considered normal provided theres no associated itching pain rash or bad smell I wouldnt be too concerned with the discharge if those others arent present 

As for the condom coming off during sex yes this can lead to pregnancy the sperm could have spilled into your vagina during your attempt to remove it 
I would advise you speak to a pharmacist or family physician regarding your eligibility for emergency contraception

Question: Please am a bit slim i want to go to gym and build my hands and the chest What food will help me achieve my results and food to let me gain wait faster
Answer:
Hi Enoch 

Im glad you already know that nutrition as well as lifting weights play significant and complimentary roles in bulking and gaining muscle mass 
However I would also like to remind you that it is a lifestyle as it involves both the time you spend in and outside the gym
You will benefit from exercising regularly and eating wellplanned diets 

The whole process of bulking up increasing muscle mass and cutting reducing body fat is a detailed one and requires real commitment 

We are yet to sign up fitness experts on the platform but we hope to eventually get a few in the coming weeks so keep checking for comments 

In the meantime I can tell you some groups of food to pay eat more of and those to avoid to help increase your muscle mass and eventual strength at the gym 

Foods to eat more of 
Beans rice moinmoin swallows such as eba amala and co are usually good during the bulking season Oatmeal makes really great breakfast 
Bread cereal crackers popcorn fruits oranges apples bananas grapes pears watermelon Potatoes yams corn green peas Vegetables and nuts too 

You should limit alcohol and processed sugars or deep fried foods 

You might also consider supplements such as whey protein creatine and caffeine which decreases fatigue and allows you to work harder 

Speak to your trainer and the gym and do some research too There are a lot of Instagram accounts that document their journeys and provide answers to questions like these you should check them out too 

Good luck with the bulking

Question: What are the chances of getting pregnant if the condom slips inside the vagina during sex three days after period
Answer:
Hi with respect to its role as a contraceptive a condom acts like a barrier It keeps the sperm from getting into the Vagina Anything that happens that allows that sperm to get into the vagina can result into a pregnancy So if the condom slips while there is sperm inside and it pours into the Vagina then pregnancy could occur  The chances of you getting pregnant if you have sex 3 days after your period are low but it is very possible especially if for example you ovulate early also note that the sperm can survive for up to 5 days after being released into the body Low risk of pregnancy but likely 
To prevent slippage of condom in the future ensure adequate lubrication you can get water based lubcricant at pharamcies If slippage happens try to use morning after pills to reduce the chances

Question: How do I permanently treat vaginal yeast infection  I Keep having recurrences
Answer: One of the commonest cause of this is poor hygiene So a way to prevent recurrence is to improve on your hygiene around your privates Change your undies as frequently as possible avoid wearing tight fitting undies in this case and preferably ones that allow ventilation around the area Also do not wash the area with antiseptic soap or Dettol use just water to wash or baby soap if any dont douche A combination of these will prevent recurrence Thanks

The vagina could become loose from childbirth due to its stretching as the baby passes through the birth canal

Question: I weigh 88 at the moment and Im a student school work barely give me time for exerciseswhat can I do please to reduce
Answer:
Hi 
Losing weight is something thats achieved by conscious effort to do so Since youre a busy person the following tips will help
Eat less carbonated drinks eg Coke malt
Eat less snacks and more of solid food
Also increase your intake of fruits and vegetables
Avoid skipping breakfast so that you dont have to eat junks during the day
Walk to andor from class plan your time around this instead of always using bike or bus 
Also when eating food like eba take less quantity of it and more of the soup to fill you up
You can also exercise on weekends when youll be less busy

I used to be a light sleeper I mean even though asleep Im almost conscious Its been five years now and when I sleep its like Im almost dead Before I could maintain a posture thorough out the night Its was so good I could sleep on a bench for the night and not fall Now I meet myself on different parts of the bed sometimes almost falling off the mattress 
Coupled with that the sleep is never enough Im always feeling sleepy throughout the day Feeling lethargic I have been to the hospital they advised more sleep But I know my body I feel something has damaged inside I have lost Vitality I can feel it

If I might add I dont know if they are related but I now have back pains I cant sit for long I cant stand for long

Whats wrong with me
Answer:
Hello 

Sounds like a case of easy exhaustion  which can be due to a number of things such as anaemia mental health disorders and chronic fatigue syndrome which can only be diagnosed after all the other causes have been ruled out

What other symptoms do you have Whats your eating habits and nutrition like Any kind of stressors Are you male or female Are there issues with your ability to concentrate or pay attention What about short term memory Are there associated body pains or tenderness Where you ill before you started feeling constantly fatigued 

Finding the underlying cause will require ruling out a number of causes until the reason is identified or ruled out and this means a number of tests However the doctor has to rule out anaemia check out your thyroid liver and kidney functions etc 

Following the results of those tests the doctor will be able to know the line of action to take
Meanwhile try to reduce physical and emotional stress you can start yoga if possible and gradual exercise programs with a physiotherapist will also help with the back pain 
The doctor might also refer you to a behavioural therapist if no exact cause is found 

Do not abuse sleeping medications as they often do not help in such cases

Question: I weigh 88 at the moment and Im a student school work barely give me time for exerciseswhat can I do please to reduce
Answer:
The process of losing weight can be frustrating but consistency and persistency is key 
Some tips to help in your journey are as follows 

1 Dont skip breakfast good options include oats and fruits 

2 Eat regular meals ie breakfast lunch and dinner in moderate portions 

3 Eat plenty of fruit and veg

4 Get more active you dont have to go to gym to be active Take more walks skip within your home YouTube videos are a good place to start

5 Drink plenty of water up to 34 L spread across the day 

6 Eat highfibre foods such as fruit and veg oats wholegrain bread and beans

7 Dont start unsustainable diets 

8 Healthy snacks for when you have to much such as fruit oat cakes unsalted or unsweetened popcorn and dried fruits

9 Cut down on alcohol and processed sugars sodas and carbonated drinks 

10 Plan your meals although its difficult to do planning your breakfast lunch dinner and snacks for the week helps you stick to your calorie allowance You may find it helpful to make a weekly timetable 

There are a lot more options out there but you must research them and find things that are easy to stick to based on your lifestyle and timing 

I wish you all the best in your weight loss journey

Question: My skin is not smooth right from I used to have pimples all over my body and its getting worse now Im 19 years old
Answer:
Pimples are common usually harmless at that age They are often a result of your skins oil glands making too much oil which then leads to clogged pores 

My advice is that you avoid popping picking at or touching them as popping may cause scarring In addition touching your pimple can transfer oil and bacteria from your hands to your face therefore infecting the pimple and not giving it a chance to heal

Washing your face regularly about twice per day especially when it gets sweaty This helps to keep oil from building up and clogging your pores Dont overwash or use harsh scrubs Acne is not caused by dirt Two gentle washings a day is enough Too much cleaning can leave skin irritated and dry triggering glands to produce more oil increasing the likelihood of pimples

Stress or hormonal changes can also worsen pimples outbreak 

Cosmetics and makeup that have a greasy consistency may also clog pores Waterbased products are less likely to cause pimples than oilbased makeup Use oilfree or noncomedogenic products those that wont clog pores on your face

Should you have an excessive amount of pimples you will benefit from speaking to a dermatologist

Question: my mouth has been tasteless for more than 3weeks and i find it difficult to perceive odour pls what is d cause and remedy
Answer:
Taste and smell disorders affects a lot of people Most times anosmia loss of sense of smell is a temporary issue caused by a number of things In some cases anosmia may persist and may be a sign of a more serious medical condition that should be reviewed by a doctor 

Some causes of smell and taste disorders are nasal congestion from a cold allergy sinus infection nasal polyps nerve injuries exposure to toxic chemicals such as pesticides or solvents abuse of certain medications etc 

If the loss of sense of taste and smell doesnt return within a few days you will benefit from a physicians review and management

Question: Some general hospital can be so scary I dont know what they observe in my wife 6 month pregnancy that is making them to conclude that it has to be opareted on when its time of delivery please what can i do and what could be cause pls
Answer:
Hello Rafiu 

Without the knowledge of your wifes medical and obstetrics history it is hard to say why an operation  cesarean section has been advised However when it is advised by your doctor a CS is usually a safer option for the mother and the baby than a vaginal delivery My advise is that you speak to the doctor who can allay your fears by explaining the exact reasons for a CS 

Some indications for a planned CS include but are not limited to the following 
1 When your babybabies are in an abnormal position or if the mother carrying more than one baby a CS is often the safest way to deliver them without dangerous complications 
2 If theres a problem with the mothers placenta If the placenta is covering all or part of the opening of the mothers cervix a CS is highly recommended for delivery
3 In cases of prolapsed umbilical cord that is when a part of umbilical cord slips through your cervix before of your baby is another indication for a CS 
4 If the physical health of the mother is a concern conditions such as a heart or brain disorders might make the doctor request a CS
5 If theres a mechanical obstruction obstructing the birth canal or if your baby has a really large size or head 
6 A previous CS although not absolute is also an indication for a CS  

As you can see there are multiple reasons for a CS this is not all and a doctor has to ensure that all of these do not lead to dangerous outcomes for your wife or child during delivery 

Please note that any attempt to forcefully go against such advice of a doctor is dangerous and can lead to unfavourable outcomes such as rupture of the womb leading to its complete removal or death 

If still uncomfortable with the doctors request you can seek another opinion with a specialist obstetrician 

I wish you all the best with the delivery

Question: During the month of May I had a very large watery discharge from my vagina my abdomen hurts so bad that I couldnt even stand properlyI saw a doctor who said it was PID I had it treated and now Im scared it might come back
Answer:
Hi 

Theres no point living in fear of something that you have control over so long as you completed your dosage and are taking precautions then I believe you should not have to worry about that 

However here are some precautions to take to  reduce your chances of a reoccurrence of pelvic inflammatory disease 

1 Practice safe sex Use condoms every time you have sex limit your number of partners and always ask about a potential partners sexual history
2 Get regularly tested for STIs If youre at risk of an STI such as chlamydia make an appointment with your doctor for testing Set up a regular screening schedule with your doctor if needed Early treatment of an STI gives you the best chance of avoiding PID
3 Request that your partner be tested If you have pelvic inflammatory disease or an STI advise your partner to be tested and if necessary treated This can prevent the spread of STIs and possible recurrence of PID
4 Dont douche Douching upsets the balance of protective bacteria in your vagina
5 Temporary abstinence Avoid sexual intercourse until treatment is completed and tests indicate that the infection has cleared in all partners

Heres to a hopeful PIDfree existence All the best

Question: What are the symptoms for hiv
Answer:
Hi Anon

Thanks for your question Human Immunodeficiency Virus HIV you must understand does not have any characteristic symptoms that define it The virus essentially weakens the bodys immune system causing a variety of manifestations which are also commonly seen in different other conditions Even after an initial period of symptoms such as fever sore throat muscle pain an infected person may show no other symptoms This does not mean that the person is now better The virus is simply quietly further taking over the body Eventually HIV if untreated will become AIDS which has even more severe rather nonspecific symptoms

As the old saying goes AIDS no dey show for face Proper treatment with existing HIV medication will prevent HIV from progressing to AIDS and will enable an individual live a practically normal life

If you suspect that you may have been exposed to the virus at some kindly do not hesitate to get tested HIV is not a death sentence

Kind regards

Question: What are the symptoms for hiv
Answer:
Hello The symptoms of HIV usually occur based on the particular stage of the infection In the early stages symptoms may look like malaria or any other ailment The person could have a high temperature headache weakness and just generally feel sick As the infection progresses the person will begin to pass watery stool vomit lose weight develop large and painful lymph nodes 
On further progress of the disease the person may have a prolonged cough whitish sores in the mouth and become really sick because the virus has weakened the bodys immune system These are just few of the many symptoms of HIV infection 
I encourage you to visit a counseling and testing center to get tested 

Hope this helps

Question: few days ago I saw a light blood which was not my period and was diagnosed With PID and was given Medications My period became late for few days but came very little though I felt the normal menstrual cramps  I want to know the cause of this even after I have treated the PID  The cause of the late and very little blood flow
Answer:
Hi 

Please note that a normal amount of menstrual flow per period can be anywhere between 5 ml and  80 ml 

Periods flow for the most part dont change after your first few monthsyears however they can changes in flow size or cycle length causing temporarily absent periods scantier flow or longer menstrual periods etc depending on your hormones Your hormones can fluctuate because of things like stress exercise diet or medication including contraceptives and strong antibiotics 
Periods can also fluctuate because of certain health conditions like infection uterine polyps fibroids or PCOS 

So I advised that you be patient let your body recover and it is expected that your normal flow will return over the next few months 
However should you still be concerned you can visit you gynaecologist for a routine checkup to rule out any other possible cause

Question: Cluster headache fever and running stomach is a sign of what
Answer:
Hi 

Headaches fever and running stomach are a rather vague set of symptoms become of how common they occur Are there other associated symptoms Does the cluster characteristics of the headache occur with fever and running stomach at the same time Is there abdominal pain nausea andor vomiting 
Depending on the answers you might have food poisoning an underlying infection or migraines 

My advice is to visit a doctor who will be able to rule out the causes and proffer treatment 

However here is a short info on what cluster headache is

It often awakens you in the middle of the night with intense pain in or around one eye one side of your head and the pain most times ends as suddenly as it started Usually leaving you exhausted after the headache 
They are referred to as cluster headache because there are bouts of attacks that occur with a period this is know as a cluster period  It can lasts for up to months and then followed by remission periods when there are no attacks 

If you suffer cluster headaches you may experience the following a sudden onset that lasts for between 15 minutes to three hours often occurs at the same time each day and mostly at night Described as an excruciating pain that is generally situated around ONE eye but may radiate to other areas of your face head and neck onesided pain with excessive tearing and associated restlessness 
Some people complain of sensitivity to light and sound 

Cluster headaches are diagnosed with this characteristic type of pain and pattern of attacks

Question: What are the symptoms for lack of blood
Answer:
Lack of blood or anaemia is a condition in which the blood doesnt have enough healthy red blood cells This leads to reduced oxygen flow to the bodys organs

There are many types of anaemia with different causes and treatments 
Irondeficiency anaemia is the most common and is usually treated with diet changes and iron supplements 
Other forms of anaemia like the mild anemia that develops during pregnancy are considered normal However some other types of anemia may present lifelong health problems

Symptoms may include fatigue pale skin shortness of breath lightheadedness dizziness or a fast heartbeat Often times other signs may present depending on the cause 

To confirm anaemia blood tests must be carried out and also the tests help point to the underlying condition and then a treatment course or plan may begin

Question: Is it safe for a pregnant woman to be drinking cold water If no is it safe to be drinking only once in a while or totally avoid drinking cold water
Answer:
Cold water during pregnancy is a subjective issue Some people do not take cold water at all because of how it makes them feel On the other hand some people seem not to be able to live without taking cold water a day

It is important to know that no matter how cold the water is it will still warm up to the body temperature in the stomach 

When some people take cold water they start having running nose sneezing and in some cases sore throat develops All these occur because cold drinks may have reduced the clearing action of the nose throat and other parts of the airway which will now result to these symptoms mentioned above On the other hand some people do not experience anything when they take cold water

In pregnancy it would be advised that you take only what suits your body Occasional cold water once in a while may not be so bad actually but you should know that you have to take what makes your body feel fine

Those with allergic conditions needs to totally avoid cold water 

Hope this helps

Question: What do you suggest for women with low milk supply when breastfeeding
Answer:
Lactation in breastfeeding mothers can be tricky at times One thing to know is that volume of breast milk produced is the lowest with the birth of the first child So if it is your first child you may not be lactation as you expect 

Also first few days of the baby may be ridded by low milk production Do not despair the baby does not need that much yet Just keep at it in matter of few days it will get better

In times like this you need to eat well food rich in protein and calories and more importantly drink lots and lots of water 

Of course you can not give or produce what you do not have 

Hope you find this helpful

Answer:
Sorry about your complaints 
Yes it does sound like a bladder outlet obstruction which is usually just a sign of a bigger condition oftentimes bladder stones or other bladder changes 

Following the amounts of investigations you have done and medications you are on I wouldnt be able to prescribe anything else However it is important that you are been managed by a specialist a nephrologist who is in the best position and has the most expertise to manage such condition 

Cheers

Question: What can I do to improve my weak erection
Answer:
Hello there and thanks for your question

By weak erections I suppose you mean inability to sustain an erection

The reasons vary and could be due to some factors like age body size or body mass index BMI disease lifestyle mental state to name a few

The strength of erections normally decreases after 50 years some say later than this However in younger men this could happen once in a while and should not be a concern except when its becoming too frequent If the frequency is increased regardless of age you should see a doctor to do a proper assessment of what could be the possible cause

Your body size may also influence your erection Being overweight or obese puts you at risk of erectile dysfunction Obesity also hampers your enjoyment of the intercourse process which could affect your esteem and mental state So its important to embark on a weight loss program and exercise often Obesity also puts you at risk of diseases like diabetes and hypertension which can affect your erection

Diseases too like the ones mentioned above diabetes and hypertension and others like prostate disorders could lead to erectile dysfunction A history of trauma to the penis or scrotum deformities in the penis etc are also possible factors Again a full assessment by your doctor could identify this

Are you in a sound state of mind Are you depressed Are you anxious and over worrying Especially with young men this could influence your erections Having a relaxed and worry free mind can improve this condition

If this tends to occur during intercourse are you indulging in foreplay with your partner Taking it slow allows for the urge to heighten and the blood flow to the penis to increase Enjoy the process of intercourse and dont rush it Talk with your partner if there are any insecurities This can boost the attraction between you two and make the process enjoyable

Exercise always as this boosts the production of sexual hormones

Hope this helps

Question: Hi A lady said my husband is responsible for her pregnancy Pls how do we know if its true
Answer:
Hey Tarah 

The best way to confirm the paternity of the fetus is through a DNA paternity test This can be done during or after the pregnancy as soon as the baby is born

There are a few centers who perform the prenatal DNA tests but these come with an increased risk of miscarriages but can be done as early as during the first trimester

Otherwise a sample can be obtained from the baby mother and alleged father as soon as delivery and analysed 

Several centers run the DNA testing you just need to do your research on the costs and plans best affordable to you

Question: What does it mean if you have light pink discharge from your vagina along side itches

The timing of the month the discharge occurs as well as any other symptoms in this case itching can help to identify the underlying cause

Are you sexually active Does your partner have any symptoms

Without treatment STIs can spread to the reproductive organs resulting in Pelvic Inflammatory Disease PID and if left untreated PID can result in chronic pelvic pain and infertility

Question: Can a woman who has given birth take the HPV vaccine
Answer:
Hi Anon

To answer your question I believe that the reference to pregnancy is to indicate a certain level of sexual activity if I am not mistaken

While the HPV vaccine is generally recommended to have been administered at around the ages of 1112 please note that one could still benefit from the vaccine as it can confer protection against other strains of the virus even if one already is infected with a particular strain

Kindly note that in addition to the vaccine it is highly important to do a Pap smear Kindly visit a healthcare facility to get more details about this

Question: I was using xasten beforebut have neva been pregnant since i was using it pls how can i treat it
Answer:
Hello 

Im not sure what you want to know about Xasten and how it connects to pregnancy or what exactly you are trying to treat Do clarify 

However Xasten is Dexamethasone a prescription drug that belongs to a group of drugs called corticosteroids They work by replacing natural hormones produced by your adrenal glands when your body cannot make enoughit is used to treat a large range of conditions  

Although dexamethasone has been known to cause increased appetite and weight gain there are other associated more dangerous side effects which include fluid retention increased blood pressure easy bruising that doesnt heal fast stomach ulcers and menstrual irregularities 

It is contraindicated in pregnancies though

Question: Hello im 22 years old  My problem that i feel my heart pulses all over my body  like head  leg  etc and i dont have any gland or heart problems Also I didnt take any medication My weight is 55 and hight is 149 so from what this symptom can be and whats the successful treatment to recover it
Answer:
Hi
Based on your weight and height youre not overweight your body mass index is 248 kg per square metre assuming your weight is in kg and height in cm But you are close to being overweight from that value so Id recommend routine exercise weekly as it fits your schedule
Also youre young so its not really expected that you have a cardiovascular problem except perhaps you were born with it or developed it over time
Please dont be worried but go to a cardiologist for proper evaluation to be sure nothing is wrong 
Best wishes

Question: Can a spouse that has been on antiretroviral religiously for the treatment of HIV for about 2 and half years have sex with her spouse to conceive without infecting the husband
Answer:
Hi
Theres always a risk of transmitting HIV during unprotected sexual intercourse but this risk is lower if the spouse has a very low viral load
Since the spouse that is HIV positive is the woman Id suggest that artificial insemination be done or still the husband can take post exposure prophylaxis within 72 hours not beyond 72 hours of the sexual intercourse in form of anti retroviral drugs

Question: I was using xasten beforebut have neva been pregnant since i was using it pls how can i treat it
Answer:
Hi
Xasten alters the hormonal balance in the body hence it causes menstrual irregularities which can ultimately hinder pregnancy
So if you want to get pregnant you need to stop the drug dont stop abruptly but taper down the dosage to reduce adverse effects
If the xasten was prescribed by a doctor please go back to him so that he can tell you how to taper down the dosage If not then go to a fertility doctor so he can tell you how to taper it down and also properly evaluate you for the infertility
Best wishes

Question: Can a spouse that has been on antiretroviral religiously for the treatment of HIV for about 2 and half years have sex with her spouse to conceive without infecting the husband
Answer:
Thanks for this question being on Antiretrovirals for 2 years or more religiously is not the good thing to look for what matters is what is the viral load of this spouse If this spouse has undetectable viral load then we will agree that she has been using her drugs very well and has been doing well Recent research tells us that when the viral load is undetectable the risk of transmission is 0 What we do advice at this stage is for the husband to still use condom regularly but for them to plan for when they want to have a child and time sexual contact where they wont use condom The chances of being infected are almost zero  

Another method we use to prevent transmission is for the husband to wear a condom that the tip has been cut off so that when he ejaculates the sperm goes into the woman 

I will advice overall that you intimate your managing doctor of your plan he will be in the best position to guide you along these
Thanks

There are also medications that can be given once other illnesses have been ruled out but theres also a need to be aware of your blood pressure before commencing

Question: I am 65 years old l have weak erection When I wanted to have sex with my wife and girl friend my erection will strong but whenever I wanted to penetrate into my wife then my penis get weak what can l do what can l do to solve this abnormal sickness
Answer:
If I understand you right you have difficulties maintaining an erection during sexual intercourse with your wife but this is not the case when you are with your  girlfriend Am I right 

As a man gets older his chances of developing erectile dysfunction increases This may be as a result of many conditions ranging from the kinds of medications hes on to other underlying diseases 

In your case I think your ED is more of a psychological one than physical It appears you are unable to become sexually excited by your wife as seen by your ability to maintain an erection with your girlfriend 

Please note that there are medications that can help you to maintain erections longer but first you must undergo a general physical test and be certified fit before such medications can be prescribed You can also choose to speak to a sexual therapist who might be able to find the underlying cause for your selective ED 

Meanwhile here are some lifestyle changes that have been known to improve erection in men stop smoking and drinking less alcohol strengthening communication with your partner exercising more and maintaining a healthy diet reducing anxiety and stressors having a regular checkup with your doctors

Question: What can I use to cure sore throat
Answer:
Depending on the cause of your sore throat you might not require any treatment 
However if there are associated symptoms such as headache fever cough etc that is long lasting then you will need to get it checked out at a doctors 

Regardless of the cause the following techniques are known to bring relief faster

1 Rest Get plenty of sleep with minimal talking to rest your throat and reduce irritation 
2 Drink plenty of fluids Fluids keep the throat moist and prevent dehydration Avoid drinks with caffeine and alcohol as that can lead to dehydration Warm liquids  are better  soups tea or warm water with honey etc 
3 Gargle with saltwater
4 Consider over the counter lozenges like strepsils or others from the pharmacy Also consider paracetamol for fever or pain of present 
5 Go and see your doctor or a community pharmacist if your symptoms dont reduce in a few days sore throats can sometimes be a symptom of a more serious illness

Question: Hi can I detect conception with a urine test after 5days of intercourse
Answer:
No you cannot detect any evidence of conception after 5 days of intercourse 

Except of course if there was sexual intercourse weeks earlier and the one few days prior was not the one responsible for the positive test

If pregnancy is not desired at the moment there are family planning methods that can help avoid unwanted pregnancies

Hope you find this helpful

Question: Please whats the cure of OCD
Answer:
Hi Bola

Obsessive Compulsive Disorder falls under a category of mental illnesses called neurotic disorders

Like other mental health conditions there are a set of criteria that must be met before a diagnosis of OCD can be made Please note that OCD unlike its potrayal in social media does not refer to someone who takes hygeine seriously It is a highly distressing condition with serious life implications for an affected person 

Due to this anyone seeking to determine if they actually have this condition must visit a specialist psychiatrist who will be in a better position to make this diagnosis and offer a solution that will range from behavioural modification to drug therapy 

Kind regards

Question: Hi Im 33years Im always in need of sex for some years now I cant stay for 2days without having sex please what will I do to stop it

Due to its importance there are a set of doctors trained to be able to cater to excessive or inadequate sexual desires which may be due to psychological or medical reasons

I would advise then that you kindly visit a specialist psychiatrist who will be able to assess you on both the pyschological and medical front in order to help you

Please understand that there is no shame attached to visiting a psychiatrist and seeking professional help is a lot better than being quiet Your conversations with the psychiatrist will be between you both and will be treated with utmost respect

Kind regards

Question:
I have not seen my period in 8 months nowI am not sexually active
I am starting to get very scared
Answer:
Hi a lot of things can affect how and if you will see your period 
1 Age depending on your age usually at about early 40s onward different people experience cessation of their menstruation which is a natural order of things

2 Previous infections and scarring  around the uterus this could happen due to previous dilation and curretage a process of abortion this affects the process that results in menstruation

3 Hormonal issues this could be due to issues around the thyroid gland cases of polycystic ovary syndrome etc

4 Drugs previous use of contraceptives can also cause it this happens like a residual effect of it in some way

5 Body changes eg weight loss

I am not sure of which might apply in your case but a visit to a doctor will help to arrive at what might be the exact cause 

If you need help in getting to see one use the contact option in the menu and we will guide you through the process 
Wish you the best

Question: Hello what can I do about a sensitive tooth Its really hurting me

If by sensitive teeth you are referring to a sensation you feel when you take hot or cold drinks then its a sign that a certain protective covering of your teeth is wearing off Dont be alarmed and there are a few remedies for it such as a fluoride gel and certain toothpastes for sensitive teeth You should also go easy while brushing and select toothbrushes with soft bristles

However it will defintely help to pay a visit to a dentist who will help you thoroughly examine your teeth Most people only visit the dentist when teeth problems come up despite the recommendation being at least twice a year

Question: My molars have been growing for over a year now Is this normal Should i take it out Especially because it brings me so much pain and discomfort and I have food particles that hide there
Answer:
Hi Olawale
Thanks for contacting Wellvis

Growth of molars is usually age dependent and are usually the last teeth as you may know The growth tends to be slower than your other type of teeth 

Pain usually comes because its pushing through the overlying gum till it reaches its final position This can be very discomforting especially when chewing I will recommend consuming softer foods so you do not have to exert a lot of force while chewing 

Pain killers can be taken to relieve any pain 

Mouth hygiene is important too You may want to use antisepticantibacterial mouthwash and avoid the toothbrush on that area as it grows 

But if the pain is unbearable youre bleeding from that area you develop a foul odour in your mouth kindly visit your local dentist for a specialist checkup
 
Sorry about the pain and hope you feel better soon

Question: My stomach usually makes noisewhether Im hungry or notwhat can I do
Answer:
Hi hope you are having a good weekend 

Are you lactose intolerance or do you eat a lot of sugar Excess amounts of processed sugars may cause diarrhea gas and increased bowel sounds

Bowel sounds are a normal phenomenon that everyone sometimes experience It is known to occur during hunger during digestion or even after eaten some kinds of foods It occurs as food goes through the stomach and small intestine

There is no specific treatment for the sounds but if caused by a known condition treatment of the condition will reduced said sounds 

Meanwhile helpful practices that are known to help reduce  bowel sounds are as follows chew slowly while eating limit sugar alcohol and acidic foods avoid food and drink that cause gas eg beans beer carbonated drinks etc pay attention to your diets and discover any existing food intolerances you may have and more importantly stay active

But if you have additional symptoms like frequent diarrhoea vomiting constipation etc or you feel that these noises are negatively affecting your life you should consider speaking to a physician

Question: My molars have been growing for over a year now Is this normal Should i take it out Especially because it brings me so much pain and discomfort and I have food particles that hide there
Answer:
Hi and sorry about your painful molarsIn addition to what my colleague said I am guessing the said painful molars are the last  teeth on each side of the lower jawI am saying that because these last molars3rd molars as they are called  are the last to grow into the mouth and as such would have arrived when all other teeth would  have taken up most of the space available  on both sides of the jawsAs a result of the limited space available these last molars dont end up growing properly such that the gums around them bear the brunt of food packing and even chewingNow the process of repeatedly chewing directly on these gums make you end up with an extremely painful  condition called PERICORONITISWhen such happensthe ultimate solution is to remove the said impacted 3rd molars
Kindly visit your dentist for appropriate examination and treatment  plan

Question: can implantation blood be heavy life period or i just had my period what the difference
Answer:
Hi

I suppose youre referring to the mild bleeding that occurs when the fertilised ovum implants on the uterus following a few days after sexual intercourse

While some facts may be difficult to recall there are some subtle hints that can be a pointer to what kind of bleeding it was Among these are the colour and volume of the blood You are most likely aware of the color of your period blood by now Implantation bleeding is usually of a lighter shade of red usually mostly spotting and barely continuous for as long as period bleeding Another important factor is whether or not this bleeding happened around the time you are supposed to menstruate If it did it might not be implantation bleeding

More importantly however please purchase a pregnancy test kit at a pharmacy near you to be sure

I would also advise the use of protection in the future particularly to avoid the risk of contracting sexually transmitted diseases

Kind regards

Question: My mom suffers seizures from time to time She has convulses 24 times in one night within the space of 23months and this has gone on for the past 8 years She had brain tests about 7 and 5 years ago respectively which revealed nothing other than typhoid and malaria parasites which were treated then This condition however persists She suffered one last night Please I need advice on the next line of action
Answer:
Hi there and thanks for your query

Seizures can be caused by many things ranging from infections issues in your cardiovascular system and even your metabolism to name a few To be able to know the cause your doctor will be interested in some information like your mums age onset of the seizures 8 years in her case duration of seizures how long does an episode last what kind of seizures one part of her body or the whole body shaking does anything happen before during or after the seizure any family history of seizures is she on any medication does she consume alcohol does it interfere with her life which does in most cases are there any other symptoms These are just a few of the many details needed to narrow down to a possible cause

If she has never had it up till only 8 years ago studies suggest that adults who develop seizures for the first time in adulthood may have a stroke and in some cases the cause is unknown 

She may benefit from long term anticonvulsants But these are not to be selfprescribed or selfadministered I will recommend seeking the consult of a neurologist a doctor specialized in the human nervous system You may be asked to repeat the brain scans since it has been over 5 years now and there is a possibility for any issues which were hidden before in the brain to be seen now This could be because it may have become more visible to the imaging device or maybe there has been an upgrade of the machine or possibly better expertise in viewing the scan

In the interim continue the good job of paying attention to her while together and continue giving her support Please remember not to put anything in her mouth while she is seizing and limiteliminate alcohol intake if any Taking a video while she has an episode to show your doctor may also be of benefit in making a diagnosis

I hope your mother gets the help she deserves and all the best to you two

Question: Have been having itching of eye and have taking elisca eye drops but not goingwhat kind of eyes drop can i take again
Answer:
Hi there and thanks for your enquiry

Itching of the eye could be an indication of allergy irritation infection etc
 It could be associated with redness of the affected eye excessive tearing and discharge of pus in the case of infections
 Though it is common practice to self medicate it is not advisable to Visiting a clinic could help distinguish what is the possible cause Why you may ask Sometimes all you may need is just an antihistamine for an allergy and yet you may be using an antibiotic like the case of allergic conjuctivits and bacterial conjunctivitis
 Provided there is clarity on the cause of the itching the drug may not be right for you Especially in the case of an infectious cause the organism responsible may not be sensitive to the eye drops you are using
 On the issue of drugs some people do not know their sensitivities to different drugs As such you are just adding more fuel to the flame
 For the case of those whose itching may be an allergy it is advisable to avoid what causes the allergy
 Do not scratch the eye as this worsens the itching sensation

My recommendation will be to have your eyes checked at an eye clinic if that has not been done yet before considering what to use next Washing the eyes with clean water may be of benefit and wear sunglasses if the light is also an issue as well as to serve as a barrier for any irritants in the environment like smoke and dust

I hope this helps you and wish you a smooth recovery so you can continue seeing the great things Wellvis has in store for the community

Question:
Womens Health
Hi I did my period on 4_7 last month and I had sex on 16 den after he released in me I uesd Andrew Liver salt with pistinor1 in the next morning and I saw my period on 1 of this month and am having pain in my lower right stomach now and av done pregnancy test and it was negative pls I want an answer pls
Answer:
Hi 

What other symptoms do you have Nausea vomiting fever constipation or diarrhoea What kind of pain is it How will you describe it On a scale of 110 how painful is it 

The causes vary and the best treatment depends on the cause Only after a doctor has asked you a few questions to rule out the various likely and unlikely reasons can a diagnosis be reach therefore my advise is that you visit a doctor who will examine you and offer treatment according to your diagnosis 

Commons causes of lower right abdominal pain in a sexually active woman include the following 

1 UTI here there are often associated symptoms such as pain on urination or going to urinate more often than usual 
2 PID  plus pain during sex andor urination and bleeding between periods or after sex vaginal discharge etc
3 Appendicitis is highly likely when the pain is specific to the right side other symptoms may include fever diarrhea constipation bloating nausea and vomiting 
4 Kidney stones 
5 Ovarian cysts
6 Endometriosis  plus severe period pains really heavy period bleeding 

Meanwhile you can take some pain reliving drugs like ibuprofen pending your visit to the doctor 

Also do note that Andrews Liver Salts has no known contraceptive effects therefore please speak to a health worker family planning nurse on your options for contraceptives

Question: Please what drug can be used to treat haemorrhoidexternal Things to avoid and things to eat
Answer:
Symptoms of external hemorrhoids may include difficulty sitting down blood on the toilet tissue after wiping and an irritated and painful anus
External hemorrhoids are much more common with symptoms such as irritation and pain itchy or burning sensation around the anus difficulty sitting down painful bowel movements blood appearing on toilet tissue after wiping 

Managing haemorrhoids often requires significant lifestyle changes this helps to reduce the severity of the symptoms These include

1 Drinking plenty of liquids and eating fiberrich diet keeps stool soft and easy to pass thus reducing irritation to the haemorrhoids during bowel movements Fruits veggies beans cereal etc are useful allies 
2 Avoid straining and pushing this worsens and exacerbates haemorrhoids Do not use harsh toilet paper preferably use water or wet wipes specific for haemorrhoids Try to get into a routine where you go at the same time every day
3 Consider painkillers like Ibuprofen to help with soreness Aspirin should be avoided as it can thin the blood and make bleeding worse
4 Take warm baths or sit in a bathtub filled with warm water for about 15 minutes especially after bowel movement Do not scrub or wash with irritating soaps
5 Topical creams for haemorrhoids with witch hazel can soothe pain however be careful of creams with hydrocortisone due to the side effect of prolonged use not more that 1 week is advised 
6 Ice packs can dull pain and bring down the swelling 
7 Wear loose soft underwear to keep the area aired out and stops moisture from building up to prevent irritation 
8 Exercise regularly to prevent constipation 
9 Sit on a cushion instead of a hard surface
10 If you must sit for a long time get up every hour and move around for at least 5 minutes

Question: Please what drug can be used to treat haemorrhoidexternal Things to avoid and things to eat
Answer:
Hi 
Sorry about your experience

1 Try to eat a lot of vegetables foods  fruits with high fibre content eg Apple wheat etc They aid digestion and will make your stooling much easier
2 Dont force your stools out when you go to defecate Drinking water lots hours before you go to the toilet will help to soften the stools
3 There are suppositories that will help ease the pain and aid the healing 
4 Avoid high fat foods and junks they digest slowly and will make your stools difficult to expel
5 Dont keep stools in for too long the longer they get the harder they become


If you follow all these you should be able to live more freely without heamorrhoids 

If the haemorrhoid isnt going back in anymore please go see a doctor its important 
Thanks

Question: A woman of 34 weeks pregnant and her last bottom tooth has hole and is paining her time to time Dentist advice that she should not remove the tooth due to the pregnancy What advice will you give her especially food to avoid perhaps like sugar to prevent the tooth from painting
Answer:
Sorry about that
Wellthere is growing  controversy amongst dental practitioners as regardswhether a heavily pregnant woman should be allowed to undergo tooth extraction or notSome  dental experts have advocated for the removal of the source of pain arguing that if the source of pain is not eliminatedthe natural chemical substances released by the body in response to such pain can induce labourHoweveranother group of dental  experts saysit is better you delay the extractionremoval of tooth  till after delivery as long as there is no obvious spreading infection
PersonallyI would recommend that you follow what your dentist says in line with the second school of thought by delaying the extraction till deliverywhich can happen be any moment  from nowThis is because the process of trying to remove the tooth might be stressful for a heavily pregnant womanBesides the dental chair poisoning is somewhat uncomfortable for heavily pregnant womenwith the possibilty of the fetus compressing on the venae cavae and possibly bringing about dizziness or  fainting spells to the mother while on the dental chair

Howeversince you said there is an obvious hole on the said tooth id recommend that you avoid chewing using  with that side till when you are ready to remove the toothThis is becausechewing on the tooth will provoke pain as long as food enters into the hole
Furthermore kindly ask you dentist to prescribe a pain relieving drug for you so you can be safe from further pain
I hope my answer was helpful enough
If you have any clarificationplease continue  via this thread

Question: Hi is it necessary to be using cotton board to be cleaning the ears
Answer:
Hi Joseph 

Cotton buds most times seem harmless however there have been many cases of significant long term damage from their use in cleaning the ears Damages such as punctured eardrums to impacted wax etc have been reported 

Earwax is actually a good thing it lubricates the ear canals to keep them functioning properly keeps insects from crawling inside our ears and prevents microbes from growing around our ear drums There is no medical need for the use of ear buds in cleaning the ears as wax is naturally removed by our ears themselves
However if you feel like theres too much wax in your ears put in 2 or 3 drops of olive oil this softens the wax and works its way out

PersonallyI would recommend that you follow what your dentist says in line with the second school of thought by delaying the extraction till deliverywhich can happen be any moment from nowThis is because the process of trying to remove the tooth might be stressful for a heavily pregnant womanBesides the dental chair poisoning is somewhat uncomfortable for heavily pregnant womenwith the possibilty of the fetus compressing on the venae cavae and possibly bringing about dizziness or fainting spells to the mother while on the dental chair

Howeversince you said there is an obvious hole on the said tooth id recommend that you avoid chewing using with that side till when you are ready to remove the toothThis is becausechewing on the tooth will provoke pain as long as food enters into the hole
Furthermore kindly ask you dentist to prescribe a pain relieving drug for you so you can be safe from further pain
I hope my answer was helpful enough
If you have any clarificationplease continue via this thread

Question: Is there a way I can know if I have Trimethylaminuria
Answer:
Hi
People with trimethylaminuria have an impaired version of the enzyme flavincontaining monooxygenase 3 FMO3 This is the enzyme that converts trimethylamine to to trimethylamine Noxide which doesnt smell badly but trimethylamine smells badly
Patients with this metabolic disorder excrete trimethylamine in their sweat urine reproductive fluids and breath causing a strong fishy odour
A biochemical test for trimethylamine in the urine or body fluids could show if someone has the disorder or not
Best wishes
