Question: Is there a way I can know if I have Trimethylaminuria
Answer:
Hello 

Trimethylaminuria is a metabolic disorder cause by the inability of the body to break down trimethylamine 
Trimethylamine has a fishy odor and is produced in the intestines when certain types of food ie eggs liver legumes fish and some vegetables are digested When it cant be broken down this leads to an accumulation in the body causing it to be excreted via the sweat urine and breath giving them  a characteristic fishy odor of trimethylaminuria

An attempt at diagnosis usually starts with the presence of characteristic signs and symptoms followed by urine test to check the amount of trimethylamine in the urine and genetic testing which are used to confirm the diagnosis

I advise you speak to your physician who will refer you for the needed investigation and to the appropriate specialist if required If you would like us to help you with one please contact us via the Contact Us tab in the menu

Question:
Is their remedy for blighted ovum

Im 2months gone no yolk sac and fetal pole seen

Is my baby safe
Answer:
Hello

A blighted ovum is what occurs when an implanted fertilised egg in the uterus fails to develop into an embryo What this means is that although theres a positive pregnancy test and other parts of the egg may have formed the gestational sac remains empty 

Unfortunately theres no growing baby

The hormone that signals pregnancy is still usually being released and this can be read during pregnancy as a viable pregnancy however an obstetric scan will reveal the true status of the pregnancy 

Im sorry to inform you that a blighted ovum eventually leads to a miscarriage and it is not able to turn into a viable pregnancy

My advise is to have a repeat scan at a reputable centre and speak to a gynaecologist on how to proceed 

I wish you all the best

Question:
If someone has diabetes how can a person managetreat foot injury while still treating the diabetes

After seeking medical advice the doctor prescribe dextrose saline to use in cleaning the wound

note the wound seems to be expanding

I was told to add bitter leaf and ginger to the diet then clean the wound with epsom salt
Answer: Hello Please DISREGARD anything you have been told Dont use dextrose or salt or whatever The problem in diabetic wounds is that the high blood sugar makes the wound difficult to heal 1st you need to be admitted to a hospital Secondly your blood sugar needs to be controlled Your wonderful should be dressed by qualified Doctors or Nurses Please visit a hospital ASAP Mismanagement of that foot could make you lose the foot or could prove fatal Hope this helps

Question:
If someone has diabetes how can a person managetreat foot injury while still treating the diabetes

After seeking medical advice the doctor prescribe dextrose saline to use in cleaning the wound

note the wound seems to be expanding

I was told to add bitter leaf and ginger to the diet then clean the wound with epsom salt
Answer:
Hello 

The first thing is to control the sugar level through medications under the supervision of a medical doctor with regular check ups 

Secondly please do not clean the wound with dextrose saline the problem is that there is high amount of sugar in the system which is making it difficult for the wound to heal cleaning with dextrose saline is basically adding more sugar to the wound 

My advise is that you visit a doctor who would request some tests and help to control the sugar level and while that is ongoing a qualified nurse will help you to dress the wound Wound dressing will initially be on a daily basis and as it begins to heal you might be required to come for dressing on alternate days and subsequently less frequently 

Again PLEASE DISCONTINUE DIABETIC WOUND DRESSING USING DEXTROSE SALINE VISIT A HOSPITAL FOR DRESSING

Question: Six weeks ago I had broken my ring finger and went to see a doctor a plaster cast was put joining my ring n small finger together to my wrist After six weeks nw yesterday the cast has been removed but I cant bend my small n ring finger nor close them to a fist
Answer:
Hi Munira 

Usually when a cast is removed it is not unusual to experience certains things such as pain swelling and in this case stiffness of the joints involved and sometimes muscle atrophy This can last a few days to weeks depending on how long the cast was on for and what you have started doing since removal of the cast 

As this is normal it is important that a repeat xray is done to ensure a correct fusion of the bones followed by some medications if indicated and most importantly physiotherapy

Physiotherapy is the best way to improve the strength and flexibility of your fingers and help you return to activity within a few weeks
A physiotherapist will design a range of techniques that suits your needs and in most cases will ensure you can do the exercises at home These exercises are important to ensure you give yourself the best chance of a full recovery 

If you need help finding a physiotherapist let us know by filling this form httpswellvishealthtypeformcomtoWAPmQe

Question: Hi doc Is it possible to conceive after removal of the uterus and one ovary
Answer:
Hello 

Good evening 

The uterus or the womb as others may call it is the place where the new born baby stays and grows to maturity 

Its absence means that there is no way a woman can get pregnant because it has been removed 

I hope this helps

Question: Hi doc Is it possible to conceive after removal of the uterus and one ovary
Answer:
Hi 

Women have two ovaries in most cases except stated otherwise the ovaries release eggs which are fertilised by sperm cells to form a baby When one is removed the other can still release eggs for fertilisation 

However when the eggs are fertilised they are implanted on the inner walls of the uteruswomb which is where it then develops into an embryo and becomes a baby Therefore when theres no uterus it is impossible to the eggs to be implanted and cant develop into a baby 

There are many supportive techniques that can support the woman in having her fertilised eggs develop into a baby usually outside of the womans body this is a kind of Artificial Reproductive Technology

Question: WHAT TYPE OF DRUGS CAN I TAKE TO PREVENT PREGNANCY FROM OCCURING AFTER UNPROTECTED SEX
Answer:
Emergency contraceptive pills morningafter pills are a safe and effective way to prevent pregnancy after unprotected sex

The medicine must be taken within 72 HOURS 3 DAYS after unprotected sex and is not intended as a regular method of contraception The medicine works best when taken within the 1st day 

An example of an emergency contraceptive pill is Postinor 2 You can speak to a pharmacist close to your for other types of emergency contraceptive medications 
DO NOT USE ROUTINELY 

Also contact your doctor to discuss other options 

Cheers

Question: good morning doctor I want to see you to help me and my wife we just say 2 months pregnant and she is complaining that her waist is paining her so what could be the problem about that please
Answer:
Hello Sir 

For many women pregnancyrelated lower back pain starts within the first trimester In most cases this is expected due to the fact that as the pregnancy progresses the womans posture changes and as the weight of the baby increases in front it pulls on your back creating a shift in balance and puts a strain on the back
Also method of sleeping is often a factor she should try laying on her side and try to be more comfortable
Release of some hormones during pregnancy may also cause the ligaments of the lower back to soften as pregnancy progresses 

Pregnancyrelated lower back pain can be relieved or reduced by the following 
1 By maintaining good posture while seating or standing also avoid standing for long periods of time
2 By squatting instead of bending at the waist when she wants to pick something from the floor Avoid lifting heavy things 
3 While in bed try sleeping on the side with pillows tucked beneath your belly and between your knees for gentle support
4 Practice pregnancysafe exercises designed to strengthen and support your abdomen and back
5 When seated try to elevate your feet and make sure your chair offers good back support Use a lumbar pillow for additional low back support
6 Try to get plenty of rest
7 Discuss these with your physician during your ANC visits 

Cheers and good luck on your pregnancy journey

Question:
Good mrng docs The surface of my vagina itches badly No itch or discharge on the inside Just the outside
 What do I use
Answer:
Hello 

Vaginal or vulva itching can be caused by irritants skin disorders infections or menopause

Exposing the vagina to irritants such as feminine sprays douches topical creams ointments etc can trigger an allergic reaction that creates an itchy rash over various areas of the body including the vagina

Some skin diseases such as eczema and psoriasis can cause redness and itching in the genital region

Vaginal yeast infection a very common condition alongside some STDs can also cause itching Yeast infection often occurs after taking a course of antibiotics which tend to destroy good bacteria needed to keep yeast growth in check

Although most causes of vaginal itching isnt too serious a case you should however contact your doctor if your vaginal itching persists or occurs along with the following symptoms ulcers or blisters on the vulva pain or tenderness in the genital area genital redness or swelling trouble urinating an unusual vaginal discharge or discomfort during sexual intercourse 

Cheers

Question:
You
A few weeks ago I tested for pregnancy and the UTP was positive then a few days later I started having some lower abdominal pain and bleeding for 2 days then it stopped I went to the hospital and the Ultrasound showed no signs of pregnancy I went back to another hospital and the same happened UTP positive but Ultrasound shown no sign of pregnancy The recent test was done on Monday Since yesterday Ive been having the lower abdominal pains and bleeding Also Ive been having some dark brownish discharge once in a while that looks like blood over the week And all this comes with the pains that feel more of cramps
Answer:
Hello 

It is possible that you might have had an incomplete miscarriage 
In situations like this the scan will show an empty uterus with no signs of pregnancy but the urineblood tests will still be positive for a few days after 
Pregnancy tests detect the presence of the pregnancy hormone hCG however after a miscarriage occurs the hormone does not disappear from a womans body right away instead the level of hCG gradually decreases falling back down to an undetectable level over a period of days or even weeks depending on how far along the pregnancy was when the miscarriage happened

With an incomplete miscarriage there is still pregnancy tissue leftover in the uterus but unfortunately it does not mean that the pregnancy is continuing or is viable Symptoms are complaints of passage of clots or pieces of tissue plus vaginal bleeding with associated cramps

A  simple medical procedure might be required to remove the retained products of conception which is usually only small pieces of the placenta These tissues will probably be reabsorbed broken down by your body in time but the procedure can help put a stop to heavy bleeding sooner as bleeding is a common symptom of an incomplete miscarriage

Please visit a gynaecologist for review and proper management should this be this case 

All the best

Question:

Answer:
Congratulations At 39 weeks pregnant youve got a fullterm baby Anytime between week 38 and 40 is usually ideal for delivery 

Knowing that your wife can get into labour any day from now lets discuss signs you should watch out for They include the rupture of the membranes water breaking that contain your amniotic fluid some digestive disturbances just before the onset of labor such as diarrhoea or vomiting the loss of the mucous plug and bloody show your capillaries rupture from the dilation and effacement of your cervix causing any discharge to appear pink or redtinged Once youve seen bloody show labor is probably just a day or two away Some women experience spurts of energy nesting instinct just before labour sets in 

I wish you and your family all the best Sir and please make sure your delivery bag is packed and ready to go

Question: Which drugs can I use to treat candidiasis
Answer:
Hello 

Candidiasis is a fungal infection caused by Candida which normally lives inside the body in places such as the mouth throat gut and vagina and on the skin without causing any problems However with prolonged antibiotics use or suppressed immunity the yeast to grow significantly to cause diseases 

Candidiasis that develops in the mouth or throat is called thrush while if in the vagina it is commonly known as a yeast infection Invasive candidiasis can also occur when Candida species enter the bloodstream and affect internal organs 

In your case what part of your body is affected 
Because the question was tagged in the womens health section I will go ahead and assume its vaginal 

Women may be more susceptible to vaginal yeast infections if they are pregnant or have diabetes The use of antibiotics or birth control pills can promote yeast infections As well as frequent douching

Vaginal yeast infections may present with the following symptoms vaginal itch with a classic a thick discharge cottage cheese consistency a burning discomfort around the vaginal opening especially if urine touches the area and pain or discomfort during sexual intercourse 

Because these symptoms are similar to many other vaginal infections which are treated with different types of medicines it is in your best interest to speak to a doctor who can tell you if you have vaginal candidiasis and how to treat it 

Vaginal yeast infections can be treated with antifungal medications that are applied directly into the vagina as tablets creams ointments or suppositories A single dose of oral fluconazole can be used For more severe infections infections that dont get better or keep coming back after getting better other treatments might be needed 

Wearing cotton underwear might help reduce the chances of getting a yeast infection Also avoid taking antibiotics that has not been prescribed by your healthcare provider

Question: Please after having sex with my boyfriend I have been feeling a severe pain in my abdomen and my waist
Answer:
Hello  

Are there other associated symptoms with the pain How old are you How long does it last Does this happen all the time or only some times etc These questions are useful to help reach a diagnosis and a treatment or at least how to reduce it occurence 

In many cases abdominal pain after sex is bearable and often resolves within minutes and not lifethreatening while others maybe severe and long lasting However if the pain becomes too severe it can lead to avoidance of sex

Some common causes are immediately clear and others might require a detailed discussion with your physician and lab investigations where necessary to get to the root

Some known causes in no particular order are deep penetration orgasm dysorgasmia urinary tract infections UTI sexually transmitted infection STI interstitial cystitis irritable bowel syndrome IBS ovarian cyst uterine fibroids pelvic inflammatory disease PID endometriosis are some conditions that might result in painful sex or postcoital sex

Therefore to completely rule out the exact cause and possible complication you should go for a physical examination with your physician 

Cheers

Question: Hello welvis I had miscarriage some years ago and did not have any money to go see the Doctor and since then I cant conceive I really need children My menses comes normally but I cant seem to track my ovulation What am I sopposed to do now
Answer:
Hello there

During ovulation a couple of physical signs can be noticed in a woman 
The cervical mucus secretion increases and transforms into a raw egg white like consistency Its usually clear and thin 
Theres also an increased libido prior to ovulation 
Theres a slight rise in basal body temperature although tracking this can be a bit cumbersome
Some women may even feel a sharp abdominal pain during ovulationmittelschmerz

You should also know that having sex 35 days prior to ovulation and 12 days after can still result in fertilization

Ill also advise that you and your partner should see your physician for fertility tests that can help detect a possible problem

I hope this helps

Question: Hello welvis I had miscarriage some years ago and did not have any money to go see the Doctor and since then I cant conceive I really need children My menses comes normally but I cant seem to track my ovulation What am I sopposed to do now
Answer:
Hi 

As you have stated you are most fertile during ovulation ie when an egg is released from your ovaries and this usually occurs 12 to 14 days before your next period starts
Therefore tracking your periods is a significant part of knowing when your ovulation is expected to be 

Some helpful signs of Ovulation are as follows 
  a raise in basal body temperature
  if you use a home ovulation kit you will notice increased levels of luteinizing hormone LH
  cervical mucus or vaginal discharge may appear clearer thinner and stretchy like raw egg whites
  breast tenderness
  a feeling of being bloated 
  possible light spotting
  and slight pain or cramping in your side

If after a year of trying with no pregnancy you should see a fertility expert to rule out and manage whatever may be the cause of the delay 

Good luck

Question: Hi doctor  whats happening to me I always get headaches when ever I stay on screen like hour or more Screen like pressing phone watching TV or even reading
Answer:
Hello Busayo 

When a person spends long hours looking at electric screens in general television computers tablets or in your case mobile phones they tend to develop what is known as digital eye strain which is associated with exhaustion back and neck pain and in most cases the eyestrain leads to headaches 

The eye strain might be due to glare on the screen poor lighting in your surrounding improper computer brightness and color or a combination of these factors

Usually when this is that case we advise that you take frequent breaks from screen time adjust your posture by walking a short distance to stretch your neck arms and back to improve circulation You can also incorporate deep breathing lessons and short meditation time You should also ensure that you are using appropriate screen glare protectors the right chair and desk etc 

In most cases these techniques tend to help with the headaches and offers relief however if you believe the eyestrain is a becoming worse hindering you daily activities or not entirely due to the screen time I recommend you see an eye doctor

httpswellvishealthtypeformcomtoWAPmQe

Question: What are chances of a guy contracting HIV from a HIV infected lady after 1 unprotected sexual intercourse with her
Answer:
You can get infected from a single sexual encounter with someone with HIV 

Although I cannot give you exact figures as regards your actual chances or probability but I know that the chances vary significantly based on other factors such as kind of sex if you are a man or woman the viral load of the person with HIV etc 

The risk is higher in people with other STIs or if the infected person has a high viral load People with HIV who are compliant with their medications ARVs can have really low viral load that they cannot infect other people most times Multiple sexual exposures increase the chances of infection Anal sex has significantly higher risk of infection up to 20 times more than vaginal sex and women are at a higher risk than men

Finally if you are worried about exposure please speak to your doctor about getting on post exposure prophylaxis

Question: Please I am not pregnant and I have water coloured  discharge from my breasts whenever I press it The discharge is colourless Is it normal
Answer:
Hello 

Good evening 

Watery or milky discharge from the breasts when one is not pregnant is not normal 

There is a condition called hyperprolactinaemia where the prolactin levels in the blood is high and usually results to this 

Prolactin is a hormone that is responsible for a woman to lactate or produce breast milk after child delivery 

Other causes include a pituitary tumour hypothroidism liver disease and kidney disease 

I advise that you go and see a doctor for a detailed history and physical examination You would also need to do some tests to ascertain the hormonal levels and even rule other other conditions 

Treatment would depend on the outcome of your visit to the doctor 

I hope this helps 

Cheers

Question: Hello Dr please are there side effects of using pillseg combination 3 as a contraceptive method Please advise
Answer:
Hi 
Combination 3 is a type of contraceptive pill that has about 2 different type of drugs in it to help prevent pregnancy they are relatively safe but there could be some side effects from its usage in the short and long term There could be bleeds headache nausea etc they can also cause blood clots in the leg especially in people who are not very active they can also affect the regularity of the menses once in a while The truth is there is no 100 safe contraception they just have differing benefits over one another You can consider getting an intrauterine implant which usually has no hormonal effect on the body and can help prevent pregnancy for as much as 10 years you can remove once you want to get pregnant Best way to go about this is to visit the family planning clinic at any government Hospital or health centre around you and the nurses there will guide you on making the most appropriate choice for you
Thanks

Question: I have a keloid on my head which I have battled with for up to 12 years I tried many things but a combination of epiderm cream and lycomysine capsule helped to reduce to just one Now the last one is growing big and I am worried Any help
Answer:
Hi 

There are no effective home remedies for keloids Also there isnt a single treatment plan that is best for all keloids We have to consider the location size and depth of the lesion the age of the patient and very importantly what treatment has been used in the past and how it was responded to

There are however numerous treatment plans which includes surgical excision intralesional steroid injection radiation therapy laser therapy silicone gel sheeting and pressure therapy 
Keloids tend to recur after surgical excision as a single treatment therefore a combination of therapies might be required 

My advise if that you go see a dermatologist who will examine the lesions and answer those above questions to design a treatment regimen for you 

Cheers

Question: Can I use cialis to boast my sex libido
Answer:
Hi 

First Libido is a persons overall sexual drive or desire for sexual activity 
Do you have a low libido or you cant maintain an erection 
Please note that CIALIS does not increase a mans sexual desire sex drive or libido It helps increase blood flow to the penis and can help men with erectile dysfunction get and keep an erection for sexual activity when sexually stimulated It does not induce erections in the absence of sexual stimulation

Cialis is a prescription drug and must be prescribed by a doctor after examining you It is not appropriate or safe for everyone to take it as certain health conditions and other medicines can make it unsafe to take Cialis

Low libido can be caused by either physical or psychological issues such as low testosterone prescription medicines too little or too much exercise chronic illnesses and alcohol and drug use while psychological issues can include depression stress and problems in your relationship 
It is important that you maintain healthier lifestyle choices improve your diet and eat healthier get regular exercise and enough sleep cut down on the alcohol and reduce stress

Question: I have noticed that i itch a lot just before  and during my periods  what could be the cause and how can i prevent or manage the itching
Answer:
Hi 

Do you itch all over your body or just in specific areas your vaginavulva region 

Vaginal itch during your period is a common experience It often is attributed irritation from your menstrual products or hormonal imbalances 

To avoid or lessen itch from irritation
 use unscented tampons or pads
 change your tampons and pads frequently
 use the appropriate size tamponpad for your flow avoiding highly absorbent sizes if not necessary
 avoid using scented products such as scented cleansing wipes in your vaginal area
 wash the area with only water and mild soap with no color or scent

As for hormonal changes occurring around your period this can cause vaginal pH to change therefore creating an environment for yeast overgrowth Along with itch other symptoms of a yeast infection may be present 

 discomfort when you pee
 swelling and redness
 cottage cheeselike vaginal discharge

Yeast infections are typically treated with antifungal medication which you may get over the counter at a pharmacy 

All in all this is not an uncommon situation however if the itching becomes unbearable or nonstop it might be the sign of a condition that should be diagnosed and treated by your doctor Go and see a gynaecologist 

Cheers

Question: Hi doctor a pregnant woman who just delivered 3 days ago has been advised by a nurse to be take wine and heat it and be drinking it They she advised that it will help it removing the blood that is still come out after delivery What your advic
Answer:
Hello 

The blood you are referring to is called lochia It is a normal expectation after delivery and this discharge usually contains blood mucus and soft tissue This is how the body removes all of the extra blood and tissue from the uterus that helped the baby grow

Lochia discharge typically continues for four to six weeks after childbirth a time known as the postpartum period Bleeding is heaviest the first few days after the baby is born but becomes lighter over days It varies from person to person and pregnancy to pregnancy 

Although its a normal occurence if you see large clots darkish things or experience very heavy flow  that soaks through a maxi pad within an hour please go and see your doctor or nurse 

This should not be mistaken with postpartum haemorrhage which is a more serious condition and requires urgent care 

As for the boiling of wine I do not know of any specific usefulness of it as regards reducing lochia I advise against it

Question: Hi doctor a baby about 3 days old and a nurse saw the baby and indicated that the baby has neonatal  jaundice She advice the baby to be taken outside every morning to receive sun light in the eyes Whats your advice

Good evening 

As regards neonatal jaundice of the 3 day old baby i would advise that the child be taken to the hospital and assessed by a doctor possibly a pediatrician 

It is very pertinent that the serum bilirubin levels of the  child be estimated and the appropriate treatment instituted for the baby 

Treatment actually depends on the level of jaundice and not every jaundice is amenable to sunlight therapy

So kindly advise them to take the child to the hospital 

I hope this helps

Typically bloodstain may be a pointer to a miscarriage and the brownish stain may be an ongoing infection that is harmful to the ongoing pregnancy 

I will just advice that you visit the closest hospital to be examined by a doctor and possibly have some tests run

I hope this helps

Please see your doctor ASAP

Cheers

Go and confirm your pregnancy status

A change in the duration of your periods can be due to innocuous reasons or something more serious 

First lets rule out the less serious stuff that can change the length of your period like a change in your schedule or stress a new birth control or particular medications you just started including pain killers excessive exercise or athletic activity significant weight changes or eating disorder Also women notice different kinds of changes in the features or characteristics of their period as they get older 

Other causes that are considered more serious might include thyroid disorders PCOS However they usually are accompanied by other symptoms such as acne or sleep disorders etc 

How long have you noticed the change If you havent noticed other symptoms it might be nothing to worry about However I would advice that you see your gynaecologist as soon as you can for a routine check up 

Cheers

Question: Please doctor I got bitten by my dog few weeks ago the dog is still alive I went to take anti rabies vaccine the pharmacist prescribed for me this days 02371428 but I stopped on the 7 please am I good to go
Answer:
Hi  

Post exposure prophylaxis PEP for rabies is given on the day of the rabies exposure or bite ie day 0 and then again on days 3 7 and 14 A fifth dose is recommended on day 28 in some cases eg weak immune system 

A rabid dog will usually show signs of rabies within several daysweeks of having the rabies virus in its saliva 

Considering its 3 weeks past your last vaccination theres not much you can do now Thankfully since the dog has remained healthy as you have made us believe for the past month then it seems the animal did not have rabies virus in its saliva at the time of the bite

However visit your on health care provider for follow up check up and wound dressing 

Cheers

Question: Please what could be the cause of severe sharp lower abdominal pain at the left hand side of a 15yrs old boy
Answer:
Hi 

How long has the pain been there and on a scale of 1  10 how severe is the pain What other symptoms are there Have you noticed any swelling on the abdominal wall Diarrhoea or constipation Vomiting Any blood in the stool Is there a fever Pain while urinating 

Well considering you have described it as a severe sharp it could be a hernia where a part of the intestines goes through a weak part of the abdominal wall resulting in severe pain It might also be testicular torsion from the testicles twisting by themselves causing lack of blood supply and severe pain 

Other causes of abdominal pain may include overeating or hunger pains usually not described as severe stomach fluinfection or food poisoning associated with history of eating bad food stomach cramps plus vomiting andor diarrhoea constipation bladder infection present with painful and frequent urination or appendicitis pain on the right side and worsened by touch moving or standing straight 

Causes vary therefore the best option is to go see a paediatrician to rule out a severe case especially if symptoms include the above stated ones andor is persistent 

Cheers

Question: Hello I finished my period like 6 days ago but this morning I observed some bleeding This has never happened before Should I be worried
Answer:
Hi Gloria 

In most cases bleeding between periods is not usually a cause for concern This is referred to as spotting and its usually light bleeding You may notice light brown spotting in your underwear or a heavy flow resembling a regular period 

Although the reasons for irregular bleeding can vary according to individual health situations pregnancy birth control or underlying infection common causes of spotting include 

contraceptive use especially during the first few months of starting a new method 

pregnancy spotting is a common symptom of early pregnancy known as implantation bleeding

physical conditions and infections spotting can also be caused by infections and physical changes in the reproductive tract or hormonal imbalances seen in conditions like fibroids uterine or cervical polyps Pelvic Inflammatory Disease PID Urinary Tract Infections UTIs etc 

spotting can also occur around ovulation andor hormonal issues

Considering this is the first time you are noticing it and there are no other symptoms I will advice you monitor it and not any other changes around your menstrual cycle however if it continues you should speak to to gynaecologist for review and examination 

Cheers

Question: What will happen to you when you take a contraceptive pill three times in two weeks
Answer:
Hi Bio 

By contraceptive pill can I assume you mean an emergency pill like postinor2 taken after unprotected sex 

If thats the case there are no life threatening effects to multiple use in most cases but like everything else we must use in moderation These are hormonal drugs and too much of it will definitely affect the body adversely in one form or another 

Most commonly it could make the period irregular which is not ideal if one is trying to avoid pregnancy For someone in a sexually monogamous relationship who really wants or needs to keep from getting pregnant relying only on emergency contraceptive pills is not an effective or cheap method There are various options of contraceptives asides condoms that you and your partner might be eligible to get 

I advise you speak to a family planning specialist to discuss your options 

Cheers 

PS contraceptive drugs do not protect one from sexually transmitted diseases We advise you insist on the use of condom if you do not know the sexual history or status of your partner

Answer:
Hello Thank you for using Wellvis At 35 weeks its normal to feel some mild pains because your womb is preparing for delivery However if the pain increases in intensity you need to see your gynecologist ASAP
About the purging it happens sometimes Pregnant women sometimes have increased bowel movements causing them to pass watery stool However its important you stay hydrated Drink lots of water The weight of the pregnancy could compress a nerve that travels to your leg and this could give you the shocking sensation you feel Also make sure you lay these complaints to your obstetrician when next you go for antenatal

Hope this helps

Question: Hi what can be done to irregular menstrual cycle especially when trying to conceive
Answer:
Hello How long have you had irregular cycles Has it been occurring since you started seeing your menses or is it a recent development

One of the most common causes of irregular cycles is hormonal inbalance Your hormones may be abnormally high or low If there are problems in your ovaries it could also cause irregular cycles Women who take oral contraceptive pills are also prone to irregular cycles

I advise you to see a gynecologist HeShe will examine you and give you appropriate tests to do 

Hope this helps

Question: Hi what can be done to irregular menstrual cycle especially when trying to conceive
Answer:
Hi 

In addition to what was said earlier PCOS can also cause irregular periods or no periods at all which can result in difficulty getting pregnant because of irregular ovulation or failure to ovulate associated with excessive hair growth hirsutism  usually on the face chest back or buttocks weight gain and thinning hair and hair loss from the head and oily skin or acne

If you have noticed these additional signs kindly visit a gynaecologist for review diagnosis confirmation and subsequent management 

All the best

Question: What kind of test would you recommend if the heart and lungs are to be checked
Answer:
Hello there and thanks for using Wellvis

There are various tests that can be done to check on the health of the lungs and heart and this usually depends on the reason for the check Some tests can give an idea of both the lungs and heart while there may be some specific to each of them 
For example
 A Chest Xray will view both heart and lungs as well as well as a computerized tomography or CT scan and a Magnetic Resonance Image MRI
 An electrocardiogram or ECG testing the electrical activity of the heart and echocardiogram looking at the flow of blood through the heart will test just the heart
 Spirometry assessing the lung capacity will test just the lungs
 There are blood tests too that can give an idea of heart and lungs functions by means of markers like troponins

These are just a few that exist out there Their costs vary and as such it is best to have a sit down with your doctor to see which is best for you

Hope this helps

Question: Hi doctor I was having constipation and swollens around my anal and experience pain whilst sitting as well as Fluctulence  I was given phlebodia Now the pains is now better but the Fluctulence still occur making me unable to sit among people for long due to this disgrace Pls how can I overcome this
Answer:
Farting is often not considered serious but excessive flatulence can be embarrassing and make you feel uncomfortable around others
Flatulence is a normal biological process and is something everyone experiences regularly People get gas about 20 times a day on average 

Excessive flatulence can usually be treated by making changes to your diet and lifestyle Since diet is the main cause of gas you may have to keep a record of what you eat and drink to identify foods that cause you trouble You may have to stop eating certain foods

Youre most likely to get gas by eating foods such as 
 Beans
 Vegetables especially broccoli cabbage and onions
 Fruits
 Dairy products
 Wholegrain foods
 Soft drinks
 Fruit drinks

Other ways to reduce flatulence include
Eating smaller meals eating slowly avoiding gum and carbonated drinks not smoking choosing lowlactose dairy products doing exercises and use of probiotics

Sometimes there is an underlying medical condition that needs urgent attention such as food poisoning or an intestinal blockage Gallbladder problems and constipation also worsens flatulence 

Cheers

Question: family planning guide please which family plan is safer for me
Answer:
Hi 

There are different types of contraception methods available such as 

 longacting reversible contraception such as the implant and IUD
 hormonals such the pill or the Depo injection
 barrier methods such as condoms
 permanent contraception such as vasectomy and tubal ligation 

Choosing the right family planning method can be tricky and is usually a very personal journey Your health status and personal needs such as when or if you want to get pregnant soon your partners needs and desires are usually put into consideration 

Usually it is best to discuss with a health care provider that will advise and help you choose the family planning method considering your needs and health thats right for you your partner and your family at large 

Cheers

Question: My symptoms are palpitations headache fainting nausea dizzinessbody weakness and recover a little after managing to eat some food
Answer:
Hello 

Good afternoon 

reading through your symptoms let us try to break them down a bit 

Firstly the palpitations how long has it been going on how old are you  are you hypertensive Are you diabetic 

Typically palpitations are pointers to a heart problem but there are other causes of palpitation that must be looked at  Some of them include  
 stress anxiety or panic attacks
conditions like hyperthyroidism 
Depression
Strenuous exercise
Stimulants including caffeine nicotine cocaine amphetamines and cold and cough medications that contain pseudoephedrine
Fever
Hormone changes associated with menstruation pregnancy or menopause 

You may want to look at these if any affects you 

For the headache this could be the result of so many things also notably stress fatigue fever too much screen time and malaria  which you need to be tested for 

Fainting attacks could be from the palpitation it could also result from hypoglycemia  low blood sugar make sure you eat as at when due 

These being said I suggest you see a doctor for a thorough examination and some blood work You maybe requested to do an ECG  which checks how fine your heart is working 

This would be followed by treatment with medications if necessary or referral to a specialist 

I hope this helps 

cheers

Question: What drug can I use for catarrh and cough

Cough and catarrh are symptoms of different illnesses most commonly upper respiratory infection 

Most times the infection is usually of a viral nature and in that case  treatment is primarily with rest and fluid to let the body fight the infection on its own In the presence of fever overthecounter antiinflammatory pain relievers such as paracetamol helps 

Drugs like night nurse contain antihistamines which often make people drowsy but they block the effect of histamine and help relieve such annoying symptoms as sneezing itching and catarrh If your symptoms arent relieved within a few days then you might need to have a doctor to examine your chest and rule out other conditions

Question: Hi Is it healthy to eat one boiled egg daily

Question:
Hello Im 22 Ive had eczema on my skin for over ten years it keeps coming and going please i need a recommendation  my skin is so embarassing
Thank you
Answer:
Hello 

Good morning Sorry about your worry 

Eczema can be quite a problematic skin characterized mostly by irritation 

Again it is good for that diagnosis to be made by a doctor for you as it may be something else as skin lesions may look similar but mean different things 

I highly recommend that you see a dermatlogist  skin doctor and have it checked out 

Meanwhile you can try these out for some relief prior to seeing the doctor 

take lukewarm baths

apply a  moisturizer within 3 minutes of bathing to lock in moisture

wear cotton and soft fabrics and avoiding rough scratchy fibers and tightfitting clothing

use a mild soap or a nonsoap cleanser when washing
air drying or gently patting skin dry with a towel rather than rubbing the skin dry after bathing

where possible avoiding rapid changes of temperature and activities that make you sweat

learn and avoid  individual eczema triggers

use a humidifier in dry or cold weather
keeping fingernails short to prevent scratching from breaking the skin

I hope this helps 

Cheers

Question: I and my wife have been trying to get a second born  for last four years what might be the problem and possible remedy
Answer:
Hello there and thanks for using Wellvis

Secondary infertility the inability to conceive or achieve a term pregnancy after having a baby can be a distressing problem with couples And I can only imagine how you and your wife feel

The possible causes for this are similar to those for a couple who have never had a baby before These include
 The frequency of sexual intercourse
 Abnormalities in sperm production and characteristics for the man as well as ovulation issues in the woman
 Abnormalities with the reproductive organs like testicular diseases in the man and fallopian tube issues like blockages in the woman
 Body weight changes Ages of the couple etc
 Complications from the last pregnancy

These are a few of the possible causes that could exist Have you both been visiting a fertility clinic together It is important that you both go together as it also serves as a good support mechanism And if youve visited a clinic before and there has been no issues detected KEEP TRYING 

Wellvis has experts in Gynaecology who can be of assistance if you are interested and will love to be referred to them for a more personalized check up and assistance So feel free to indicate any interest and hope you both achieve success in conceiving

Hope this helps

Question: Good morning my daughter is 11years and she suffering from vaginal infectioand me tooplease which drug can I used Thanks v
Answer:
Hello 

Vaginal infections are a group of infections that affect the vagina It could be caused by different types of bacteria or viruses it can also be from yeast 
Therefore it is important to understand the exact cause so one can get treated and then avoid getting it again 

Although diagnosing them can be tricky especially without tests but symptoms often help to narrow the cause and type of infection down 
do you have any vaginal discharge what colour how heavy what smell any sensation of itching burning swelling or soreness around or outside of your vagina does it burns when you pee any history of similar symptoms in the recent past does you partner have any other complaints etc 

Meanwhile to help reduce the symptoms and reoccurrence the following can help 
 keep your vaginal area dry
 wipe from front to rear after using the toilet
 switch to looserfitting cotton underwear
 avoid regular tightfitting jeans or pantyhose
 avoid chemical irritants in deodorized tampons 
 do not use douches or feminine hygiene products as regular bathing is usually adequate to cleanse the vagina
 
Speak to your doctor for review

Question: Good morning Doc what could possibly cause serious pain on the left side of the chest and lower back pain in female
Answer:
Hi 

Short Answer  a lot of things 

Chest pain and pain in general can have causes that are due to diseases of the underlying organs referred or radiated pain or just be musculoskeletal in nature Cause of musculoskeletal pain include heavy lifting weight lifting blunt trauma etc 

Chest pain is never something to ignore particularly because you have referred to it as severe There are a lot of organs in the chest region and it might be due to diseases of any of these organs also note that it might not be 
How would you describe this pain Is it permanent or it comes and goes On a scale of 1  10 how would you score it How long have you had it Any dizziness spells Any other symptoms Is it affecting your breathing These are some of the questions a doctor will need answers to while also examining you and maybe requesting for some labs 

Anyway my point is quite a few medical conditions are characterised by symptoms of chest pain disease of the heart lungs gastrointestinal system muscles and bones of the chest region even panic attacks etc therefore if you have sever chest pain for no known reason please see your doctor for review investigations and treatment ASAP 

The same thing for the lower back pain but this is commonly as a result of strain of the muscles and ligaments in the lower back which can stretch or tear due to excess activity or poor posture Disc injuries or inflammation of the joints of the spine are also common causes Your doctor will ask for your age your past medical history day to day activités etc to help reach a diagnosis Meanwhile you can try overthecounter pain relievers stretching and massages use ice packs or warm water bottles for the pain while you prepare to get a physical evaluation from a doctor 

All the best

Question: I am 36 weeks and 5 days pregnant and I have urinating frequently my mucus plug comes out once and it is pure white just yesterday it came out yellowishbrownthen after that in the night of yesterday I had a painful contraction in my lower back which lasted for 30 minutesplease is that labour
Answer:
Good afternoon Chiamaka Welcome to Wellvis 
Good to have you here 
Apart from urinating frequently I would like to ask if you have any other symptoms like 
pain while urinating
how many times do you urinate in an hour 
do you find it difficult to hold urine unlike before necessitating you to rush down to the toilet asap 
If any of these coexist with your symptom  you might have a Urinary Tract InfectionUTI and would advise you see your doctor asap to do some tests for confirmation and treatment Meanwhile I would also advise you ensure cleaning from front to back whenever you use the toilet for future prevention Considering the fact that you are close to termdelivery  having symptoms suggestive of UTI and experiencing something that feels like a contraction  I advise you see your  doctor ASAP because an untreated UTI might make you fall into labour earlier than expected 

Regarding the signs of Labour they include
 water dripping down your legs esp when you attempt to use the toilet  cough etc

consistent painful intermittent contractions of the womb lasting less than a minute and noticeable by the hardening of your womb when you touch your abdomentommy 

also passage of mucus stained with blood 
You mentioned you have been seeing mucus which is whitishyellow brown  I would like to ask if you have been having unusual discharge prior to now If present 

Is it malodoroushas a specific smell 
Thincheesythick
Any itching or soreness of the vagina 
Has it increased in quantity 

If yes  to any of the above I advise you to see your antenatal care doctor so you can be examined and treated promptly 
I hope this helps 
Wish you a safe delivery

Question: A woman that had tooth problem during pregnancy and has now delivered Someone os saying that she should wait for 3 months after delivery Please advise when is safe for her to remove the teeth since she has now delivered
Answer:
Firstlypregnancy is not an  absolute contraindication to dental treatment
Only that  it is safe to delay elective dental treaments  until after deliveryin women still  in their  1st  or  3rd trimestersThis is because of a  couple of factors vizThe risk of  exposure of the  foetus  in the first trimester of pregnancy to radiation from dental xray and also the risk of orthostatic hypotension hence the resultant  syncope that is likely to  happen when a  heavily  pregnant woman sits on the dental chair for  long while undergoing dental treatment
Howeverwhile  dentists would take adequate measures to reduce these risks dental treatment could still be done during pregnancydepending on the severity  of the patients symptoms and also depending on  whether the said treament is invasive or noninvasive
As for the  dental treatments which might warrant postponement until after deliverysuch treatments can be done anytime after delivery as long as  the woman has been certified fit by her doctors to go home
Even though there is no time framea dentist could decide to wait for three months depending on the emotional readiness of the patient and other patient based factors
However to the best of my knowledge  there  is no evidence from research  stating any benefit  to waiting for 3months  post deliverybefore initiating dental treatment

Question:
How Can i caculate how olad my pregnancy is And take of drug to stop vomiting is it har
mfull
Answer:
Hi Success 

There are different ways to calculate your due date 

You can use your last menstrual period LMP The number of weeks that have passed since the first day of your last period indicates how old in weeks your pregnancy is To work out your likely due date count 280 days 40 weeks from the first day of your last period

Using the first ultrasound scan during your antenatal visit your healthcare provider will also check on fetal growth and monitor other development milestones Ultrasound scans ALSO provides the most accurate estimate for how many weeks pregnant you are and what your due date will be This is the MOST RELIABLE method and is particularly useful if you dont know the date of your last period or if your menstrual cycles are irregular

Nausea and vomiting are common in pregnancy especially in the first trimester usually referred to as morning sickness In some cases some pregnant women experience excessive nausea and vomiting that might result in hospitalisation from dehydration 

Seek medical help if vomiting is so severe or constant that the person cant keep down fluids or food The doctor may need to treat you for dehydration and may recommend medication to control vomiting during pregnancy

Cheers

Question: Am  having asthma what drugs is the best for me
Answer:
Asthma is a chronic disease of the lungs which causes the lining of your airways in your lungs to swell and produce excess mucus  thereby makes breathing difficult It is characterised by coughing wheezing shortness of breath and chest tightness 

Asthma attacks might be mild or severe and can be intermittent or persistent It can be worsened by infections allergies or exercise or many other triggers 

If you think you have asthma please go to a doctor who will examine you then ask about your symptoms and medical history Some lung tests will also be requested to classify the severity of your asthma 
Based on his examination and results of the tests the doctor will prescribe medication to prevent frequent attacks and also those to control and stop ongoing attacks Your doctor will work with you to create a personalised asthma treatment plan that will outline your treatment medications and prevention plans 

Meanwhile stay away from triggers like secondhand smoke exhaust fumes or other types of pollution stop smoking if you do etc

Question: My friend went to UCH the clinic where they test and treat disease like HIV and other things now she found out that her friend whom she had sex with was HIV negative but she still feels some type of way she was prescribed PEP drugs from the hospital because she demanded for it Now shes paranoid that she got tested with a used needle Can this actually happen in such a standard place
Answer:

To clarify your friend had sex with with someone who is HIV negative and then went to get HIV screening test done she insisted on get Post Exposure Prophylaxis despite testing negative as well

To reiterate theres a very very low possibility that she was tested with a used needle even much lower at a reputable facility like UCH

Question: How many days does ovulation last for Ive been having PMS symptoms after two weeks of having my last period is it normal Joint ache and muscle aches are they normal during ovulation and also rise in body temperature
Answer:
Hi 

Ovulation typically happens around day 14 of a 28day menstrual cycle For those with varying cycle duration it might occur in the some days before or after your cycles midpoint Generally ovulation usually occurs halfway through your menstrual cycle counting from the first day of one period to the first day of the next

Ovulation typically lasts about 48hours 2 days 

Yes Your basal body temperature rises during ovulation also it is possible that vulva or vagina may appear swollen Ovulation is associated with an increase in vaginal discharge that is usually clear and stretchy Other associated symptoms may include light bleeding or spotting breast tenderness increased sexual drive ovary pain on one side of the abdomen 	

PMS signs tend to appear in the two weeks before your next period and slowly disappears after your period Joint pains and muscles are not characteristic signs of PMS but it varies in different women Are these your usual PMS signs 

You should visit your physician if you dont feel better once you get your period as you might be having an underlying illness 

Regards

Question: Hi doctor my wife delivered about 1 month 2 weeks ago and about 3 days ago she started to experience bleeding We went to the doctor yesterday and the doctor said that it menstruation but we need to monitor it I was thinking thay she will start menstruation about a year after giving birth
Answer:
Hi congrats on the new born baby 

It is normal for a post natal lady to resume menses 40 days after the birth of the baby 

For some people who do not menstruate and are breastfeeding their baby exclusively some of them experience what is termed lactational amenorrhea meaning they do not menstruate for the period in which they are breastfeeding the baby Most likely your wife does not fall into this category 

Also menses that come after post natal period might be irregular thus the need to monitor it 

Hope this helps regards

Question: Please i want you to help me with this problemever since ive started having a sexall I feels is painit happens 510mins while am having sex i have treated utiyeast infectionI have tried having it when am in the mood but its  still the same
Answer:
Hello Thank you for using Wellvis Sorry about your issue

A couple of things could cause painful sex 

It could be that your vagina isnt properly lubricated This causes bruising and injuries leading to pain 

The force of penetration could also be an issue The more the force the more painful it is 

Also there could be some previous injuries you sustained which have not healed and they get bruised during penetration 

Theres also something called vaginismus Its a condition where there is constant and excessive contraction of the vaginal muscles during sex 

But you can only be diagnosed after proper examination so I advise you to see a gynecologist who will examine and treat you

Hope this helps

Question: Please i want you to help me with this problemever since ive started having a sexall I feels is painit happens 510mins while am having sex i have treated utiyeast infectionI have tried having it when am in the mood but its  still the same
Answer:
Hi 

What you have described is what is called dyspareunia pains during sexual intercourse  For some women the pain is only a temporary problem for others it is a longterm problem

To better understand this condition you have to provide answers to certain personal questions such as age sexual history and habits any history of sexual violence etc This will help to narrow the possible cause and subsequent management protocols 

Oftentimes the pain results from inadequate vaginal lubrication firing sex which is often resolved when the woman becomes more relaxed when sufficient amount of foreplay is introduced or if the couple uses a lubricant

Other reasons for painful sex may include one or more of the following 

1 Vaginismus which is the involuntary spasm of the vaginal muscles usually due to a underlying fear 
2 Vaginal infections such as yeast infections may also result in intermittent sexual pains 
3 Cervical uterus and ovarian changes or deformities such as cysts polyps and fibroids can lead to pain especially at deep penetration
4 Endometriosis
5 Pelvic inflammatory disease PID With PID the tissues deep inside become badly inflamed and the pressure of intercourse causes deep pain
6 During menopause the vaginal lining can lose its normal moisture and become dry 
7 Vulvodynia a chronic pain that affects a womans external sexual organs 

As stated earlier treatment is based on the identified cause Meanwhile make sure to practice gentleness and patience use sufficient amounts of waterbased lubricants

All symptoms including mood changes must be discussed with your physicianobstetriciangynaecologist as they can be help with diagnosis In some cases you might require sexual therapy and interventions to manage past sexual and non sexual traumas 

Cheers

Question: I had unprotected sex with my bf on the 11th of November and took post pill afterwards about a week later I was having sore breasts and feeling tired I wasnt bothered cause I thought it was my period but Ive not seen my period and I went for a test yesterday and the pt was negativeIve still not seen my period should I be worried
Answer:
Hi 

The morning after pills have minor side effects which typically last only a few days they include

 Nausea or vomiting
 Dizziness
 Fatigue
 Headache
 Breast tenderness
 Bleeding between periods or heavier menstrual bleeding
 Lower abdominal pain or cramps

Sometimes emergency contraception can also change the length and duration of your monthly menstrual cycle making your next period come as much as a week earlier or a week later than usual If your next period is significantly late you might consider repeating the PT 

Also if you have bleeding or spotting that lasts longer than a week or develop severe lower abdominal pain within weeks of taking the morningafter pill please contact your doctor 

Regards

Question: Hello Im 21 years of age and Im a traveler I was diagnosed with TB closely 6 months now During my earlier times of getting my treatment I took medication for only 3 weeks and there was a need for me to fly back to my country in order to proceed with my treatment but I missed two weeks of my treatment and i started afresh with the medication since I came down and its been 3 months 2 weeks now My first 2 months test result came as negative So I want to know if another negative outcome of my test result within four months of being under treatment can I be declared as cured Because my Visa time is due for me to return Please I really need vivid explanation on this thank you
Answer:
Hello Charles

NO you cannot be declared cured within 4 months of using drugs for tuberculosis 

The test conducted after two months that was negative shows improvement and must mean that youve been started on a continuation phase of tuberculosis therapy which requires lesser number of drugs This phase lasts for about 46 months after the first phase of 2 months In total there are about 68 months of therapy before before which you can be declared cured after your tests are negative 

I hope this helps

Midlife crisis isnt officially a medical diagnosis and because there is no specific sets of symptoms or signs to specifically diagnose midlife crisis doctors tend to have a difficult time addressing it  
However what we can do is to rule out identifiable health issues based on the symptoms you are experiencing either physically or mentally and to ensure that it is indeed just a midlife crisis and not a manifestation of an underlying illness 

My advice is to visit a physician for review have a discussion regarding the symptoms and signs you are experiencing and possibly have a medical checkup If required you might be advised to speak to a therapist who will help you develop better cognitive and emotional coping skills with the said crisis 

Cheers and all the best

Question: What are the early symptoms of HIV that are very popular
Answer:
Hello Thank you for using Wellvis

When someone is newly infected with HIV the person may not show symptoms because the virus has not multiplied to the extent of causing symptoms If the person is tested the virus may not be detected This is called the window period and it usually lasts for about 3 months

However subsequently the person may begin to have feverrise in body temperature headaches diarrhea Seed like tissues called lymphnodes around the body may get enlarged and painful The person begins to fall sick easily because the immune system is weak 

The best way to know if one is infected is via a test If its negative it should be repeated after 3 months 

Prevention is key

Abstain or Be faithful or Use a condom 

Hope this helps

Question: What does it mean sometimes when your eyes are twitching
Answer:
Hi 

Twitching or spasms of the eyelids often occur with no identifiable cause but might be worsened by the following 

 eye irritation or infections 
 fatigue lack of sleep physical exertion and stress 
 some medication side effects
 use of alcohol tobacco or caffeine

If the twitching results in uncontrollable winking or blinking that affects your daily life then you must visit a doctor preferably a neurologist for review and examination 

Meanwhile some conditions you should avoid are 
eye infections like conjunctivitis Apollo 
dry eyes and irritants such as wind bright lights direct sunlight or smoke
fatigue and stress
excess alcohol or caffeine
stop smoking if you smoke

Question: For someone who used to have heavy flow after some years the flow reduced what could likely be the problem
Answer:
The volume of menstrual flow might change due to no significant changes in the womans body but often times the change occurs due to the following 

age as you get older and closer to menopause the flow will reduce this is due to hormonal changes

weight and diet losing or gaining a large amount of weight will alter your menstrual cycle  

stress and exercise poor sleep eating disorders medications and other hormonal conditions can also affect your menstrual cycle

Question: Good day please I want to enquire more about PGD I am AS and my partner is AS we got info that PGD helps to prevent having SS children Please I want to know how it works and how true and the cost
Answer:
Hello 

Preimplantation genetic diagnosis PGD is a procedure that is performed during in vitro fertilisation IVF a form of assisted reproductive technology 

IVF is the process of fertilisation by extracting eggs from a woman and retrieving a sperm sample from the man and manually combining them to form an embryo babies develop from embryo The embryos is then transferred  implanted into the uterus of the mother 

With PGD the genetic makeup of each embryo can be determined before being transferred into the uterus of the woman during IVF therefore almost completely eliminating the risks of bearing a child with sickle cell Please note that PGD is not 100 accurate 

Other options are prenatal diagnosis which is usually done while the couple is already pregnant it involves selective abortion of affected pregnancies And is significantly cheaper 

Cost of the procedure differs based on location centre and health status of the couple However it is said to be in the millions or Naira 

Speak to your primary physician or gynaecologist if you would like to consider this 

For more information on centres that offer this procedure and appointment bookings kindly fill this form  httpswellvishealthtypeformcomtoWAPmQe

Good luck

Question: For someone who is still a virgin that underwent Pap smear test can she loose her virginity in the process
Answer:
Hi 

No getting a Pap smear doesnt take your virginity 
Virginity has a personal definition it is not a medical or physical condition People are commonly considered virgins if theyve never had penetrative sex 

Please note that hymens can be stretched open the first time during vaginal sex sometimes causing some pain or bleeding this however is not always the case for everyone There are other ways that a hymen can be stretched open riding a bike doing sports or putting something in the vagina accidentally to on purpose like a tampon or during a Pap smear When the hymen is stretched open it doesnt grow back

Virginity and the presence of a closed hymen are not mutually exclusive therefore you cant tell if someone has had sex by the way their hymen looks or feels Some people are born with hymens that are naturally open also there are many other activities besides sex can stretch your hymen 

Cheers

Question: What effect does it have on me if Ive been diagnosed as diabetic but I continue with my normal diet I have been monitoring blood sugar and it has remained normal
Answer:
Hi 

How and when were you diagnosed with diabetes How and where have you been monitoring your blood sugar Do you own a glucometer Do you check before or after a meal 

Symptoms of diabetes vary and this is often dependent on how elevated your blood sugar is In many cases when blood sugar is only slightly elevated you might not have any discernible physical symptoms However when significantly elevated or long lasting signs and symptoms of diabetes may include the following drinking more water increased urination high thirst and hunger weight loss regular tiredness eye problems injuries that doesnt heal quickly and frequent infections 

Complications of diabetes develop gradually and the longer you have uncontrolled blood sugar the higher the risks of complications They can be disabling and lifethreatening They include cardiovascular problems such as coronary artery disease heart attack stroke and narrowing of arteries atherosclerosis Nerve damage which may lead to loss of all feelings and sensations in the limbs and in men it may lead to erectile dysfunction Damage to the kidneys eye etc may also occur 

Ideally a test called Glycated hemoglobin A1C test is the best way to know what your diabetic status You should visit your doctor or a lab and request for this test You should also repeat a fasting and 2hours post prandial blood sugar at a reputable centre to confirm diagnosis 

Meanwhile ensure that you eat healthy foods that are low in fat and calories but higher in fiber Focus on fruits vegetables and whole grains Get more physical activity of about 30 minutes of moderate physical activity a day such as brisk daily walks or swimming And dont forget to aim to lose some body weight to reduce the risk of diabetes

Should you require an appointment or help finding a doctor or lab in your locality fill this for and we might be able to help you locate one httpswellvishealthtypeformcomtoWAPmQe

Cheers

Question:
Hi Everyone
So two days ago I noticed that I have a little blister on my vagina lips and I was feeling this pain on d lower abdomen of my right hand side So yesterday I tried having sex and it was kinda painful penetrating so I stopped I really dont have money to go to the clinic so I just want to know if any professional advice can be given or if anyone can explain what this is or if you have ever experienced something like this before
Answer:
Hello 

A little blister is very subjective What you have referred to as a little blister might be big enough for serious concern 
Blisters or sores on the labia sometimes happen due to friction and resolve on their own while sometimes it may be due to certain skin disorders or as symptoms of a sexually transmitted infection STI

The associated pelvic pain and pain during penetration intercourse is very suggestive of an STI 
You will need a physical examination and tests to identify the actual cause and a definitive diagnosis It is also important to find out if the cause is an STI and subsequently treat to avoid spreading it to sexual partners 
You are advised to abstain from sexual activities for now 

Please note that untreated STIs can cause serious health complications such as pelvic inflammatory disease PID infertility scarring of the reproductive organs and an increased risk for ectopic pregnancy

Please endeavour to visit a clinic as soon as you can 

Be well

Question: 1 How deadly to s hepatitis B and how can it be managed
Answer:
Hi 

Hepatitis B is a serious liver infection caused by the hepatitis B virus HBV It can be deadly if not treated early enough
The virus is passed from person to person through blood semen or other body fluids
Commonly spread by sexual contact sharing of needles or from mother to child

Having a chronic HBV infection can lead to serious complications such as the scarring of the liver cirrhosis liver cancer or liver failure

Once diagnosis has been made treatment modalities or management is determined by your doctor preferably a gastroenterologist based on duration of the virus acute or chronic Antiviral medications and liver supplements are offered in treatment 

I advise that you speak to a doctor or specialist for management

Question: Hello doc I will like to be enlightened or adviced on this dental issue I have Went to the dentist cause I complained about experiencing sharp pain when I take cold drinks so they washed d teeth removed d existing plaques and filled a tooth next to d one I feel pain in but d pain continued then went to another dentist this time around an xray was done According to d explanation given d pain is due to erosion bw two tooths So they made me gargle with a foamy substance then flushed d particular point in between the two teethwere I feel d pain Then I was given mouth wash and a sensitivity tooth paste to be applying that d pain will go and it really reduce like say from 100pain  down to10 So its now 4wks after and I am feeling d sharp pain again Pls I need your opinion so I know exactly what do now cause u know going for dentistry is a bit expensive
Answer:
Hello Sorry about that
Please note that the washing that was done is a routine dental treatment that is supposed to be done  every 6 months and it removes  accummulated plaquecalculus and stains on the teeth
Infact even without having any dental complaint we need to have such a proceedure done every 6 monthsIt is like a way of cleaning  dirts in your   mouth
Having said thatthere are lots of factors that can cause teeth sensitivity known as dentine hypersensitivityExamples include factors like frequent consumption of acidic fizzy drinkswrong brushing tehniques to mention but a few
Basicallythe enamel  is the outermosthardest and  protective layer of the teeth while the dentine which is the next layer after the enamelis not as strong
In view of thisany insult to the tooth that degrades the enamel will expose the naturally sensitive dentine to further injuryThat is why the sensitivity phenomenon is called dentinal hypersensitivity
Sorry for your persistent case of teeth sensitivityI  however  think you need to visit the dentist once more for a thorough assessment
Best regards

Cheers

Question:
Compliments of the season to you from here

My question is 3in1

Ive heard insinuations that urinating immediatelysome minutes after sex could prevent pregnancyinfection Please how true is this Im trying to conceive and I do feel the urge to urinate immediately after sex sometimesJust like today and I had to wee

My second question is that after sex sperm comes out of my vagina sometimes almost immediately and  at other times after some minuteshours Does this call for concern and can I still get pregnant  Though its been happening for years now even before I had my daughter two years ago I used to lie still in bed and sometimes raise my legs against the wall so that the sperm will not come out I want to get pregnant again please

Thank you
Answer:
Sex happens in the vagina not the urethra So urinating after sex does not prevent pregnancy
During sex organismssome of them may be infectious are exchanged between partners and some may get into the urethra Urinating after sex may flush the urethra as an attempt to remove organisms but dont rely on it Practice safe sex

After sex semen flows back out of the vaginaseminal effluvium This is expected and normal as the vagina does not have a lid Dont be alarmed by it and dont get scammed by quacks who wants to steal money from you in the name of treatments

A man releases between 50  250 million sperms per milliliter of sperm upon ejaculation Only 1 is needed to fertilise the females ovumegg So unless your partners semen or sperms have a problem you dont have a problem

However if your partner and you have been having adequate sexual intercourse which means
1 Penovaginal sex
2 at least 3 times per week on alternate days
3 the male partner ejaculates inside the woman
4 and it has been for at least 12 months
but no pregnancy See a gynecologist for assessment

Question: What causes muscle pool in the leg
Answer:
Hello Chuks 

Good morning By muscle pool I believe that you are referring to muscle pull or muscle cramps 

There are quite a few notable causes of muscle pull or cramps 

When there is poor blood circulation to the legs it can result to cramps This is one of the reasons you are advised not to sit down for very long hours at a stretch 

Another reason is dehydration You need to make sure you get in enough fluids into your system 

Another cause is muscle fatigue which occurs whena muscle or group of muscles have been used repeatedly without allowing them time for adequate rest and recovery 

Then for those who exercise it is good to engage in warm up exercises before the main activitiy to make sure youdont develop cramps 

Another cause is exercising in hot weather This is not very helpful as one gets quickly dehydrated 

 I hope this helps 

Cheers

Question:
Technique Axial T1 Axial T2 Sagittal T1 Sagittal T2 Sagittal ST1R

Finding There is mild straightening of the cervical spine with no obvious osteophytosis The vertebral body heights marrow and signal intensity are preserved There is no abnormality noted in the disc

The spinal cord appear normal in thickness and signal intensity However a soft tissue mass with intensity consistent with that of measuring 31cmx21cm in size is noted at the level of C5 to C7  vertebrae probably a lipoma

The adjacent facetal joint appear indistinct

At C2C3 C3C4 C4C5 C5C6 and C6C7 showed normal  disc hydration with an unremarkable ligamentum flavum  and neuroforamina however the loss of distinctiveness of the articulating bones of the facetal joint at the level of C5C6 and C6C7 is highly suspicious of early onset degenerative changes probably post traumatic 

Conclusion No evidence of cervical fracture or features of osteochondrosis

CT spine is advised in view of suspicious facetal indistinctiveness

Question: I took PEP for 28 days after exposure but still tested positive what should i do
Answer:
Hi 
If you have tested positive then you should get to any General Hospital or teaching hospital around you to do a confirmation test to be sure If the result remains positive you will be put on drugs immediately Its important that you are started on treatment immediately as the earlier you start the better I want you to know that being tested positive is not a death sentence it doesnt mean that the world has come to an end I know people who have been positive for over 20 years and are still alive and thriving They are doing fine because they are taking their drugs and following instructions that they were given As long as you are on drugs you will do fine with nothing to worry about People who are on their drugs and comply with directions get to have kids who are born negative and are uninfected So anywhere you are head to a General Hospital or Teaching hospital and ask for a confirmation test or the HIV clinic and you will be managed as required
Take care

Question: Can a HIV positive mother breastfeed her child for how long
Answer:
Hi 
The decision on breastfeeding is made in agreement with the mother the family and the doctor If the babys parents can afford to sustain the usage of formula feeds for the child for as long as the child needs it more than 6 months then not breastfeeding is an option HIV positive mothers can breastfeed the child when born is placed on drugs for a few weeks the mother is placed on drugs too usually during or before Pregnancy and if she uses her drugs well the chances it infection are almost nil They are also advised not to mix formula and breastmilk if they choose breastmilk then they must give breastmilk alone and not mix with formula this is very important
They can breastfeed for as long as 1 year exclusively for 6 months and with supplementary feeds for the next period
Speak with the doctors that manage you and discuss your breastfeeding options with them
Wish you the best

Question: Good afternoon Ive a small lymph node in my groin area should I be worried Ps theres no other swollen part its just being there for two days
Answer:
Hi 

Infections are the most common cause of swollen lymph nodes 

Lymph nodes typically help the body fight off infections they work by trapping microorganisms to prevent them from infecting other parts of your body 
Swollen nodes in the groin can be caused by an injury or skin infection in the legs or foot some sexually transmitted infections STIs can also cause swollen lymph nodes in that area

Do you have any other symptoms Vomiting rash night sweats weight loss loss of appetite fatigue etc Also how long have you noticed it Is it painful 

In the absence of other symptoms I wouldnt be worried 
I would ask that you monitor it and visit a doctor if it increases in size or there are noticeable growths of other lymph nodes neck armpits back of your ears etc or of it persists for up to 4 weeks and other symptoms appear 

Meanwhile resting and applying a warm moist compress to the swollen area may help to relieve pain and swelling Also try to find the source possibly an injury if possible 
You will also benefit from a physicians review and check up as soon as possible  

Happy Holidays
