Question: What causes boil on the eye lids
Answer:
Hi 

Like all boils boils on the eyelid are skin infections that occur around a hair follicle or oil gland resulting in a red painful lump to form as pus collects under the skin A boil that occurs on the eyelid is called a stye

An eyelid boil cant always be prevented However you can reduce your risk by taking the following preventive measures washing the face every day with soap and water disinfecting contact lenses and changing them regularly completely removing all eye makeup before going to bed avoiding sharing towels or washcloths with anyone who has a stye 

Cheers

Question: Please does anxiety causes high blood pressure And what advice for someone with anxiety and how to get rid of it
Answer:
Hello Micheal 

Good evening Yes anxiety can cause high blood pressure BUT just a momentary rise in blood pressure which normalizes after a while or when the source of the anxiety is gone 

It is usually the bodys response to danger  the flight fight or fright syndrome 

If one has a sustained increased in blood pressure over three measurements at different times it warrants an investigation and physical examination by a doctor 

Some causes of hypertension are obesity alcohol sedentary lifestyle heart diseases kidney diseases endocrine diseases etc the cause needs to be found 

As regards the anxiety it is best that you talk to a mental health professional to help identify the root cause of the anxiety and get you treated 

I hope this helps

Question: Please doctor I need your advice Its two weeks after I had a abdominal myomectomy surgery I want to know when its safe to have sex with my husband
Answer:
Hello there and thanks for using Wellvis

First of all I hope youre feeling much better following your recent surgery

Regarding sexual activity most surgeons recommend waiting a minimum of 46 weeks after surgery before having intercourse This allows for the pain to subside and for the surgical wound to heal better There are other factors involved depending on the reason for the surgery

However when you do resume sexual intercourse it is recommended to wait for at least 6 months before getting pregnant if you are trying to

Your followup checks with your gynaecologist is very important and you should report any worrying symptoms like a high fever nausea or vomiting severe pain bleeding from the surgical site chest or breathing issues abnormal vaginal discharge etc

Also moderate walking is helpful in your healing process and eating healthy too with high fibre to avoid constipation

Once again thanks for using Wellvis and in case you want a more personalised experience we have the live chat function which connects you to one of our verified doctors at a very reasonable fee 

I hope this helps and speedy recovery

side effects of certain medications

Question: Solution for quick ejaculation
Answer:
Hi 

Quick or premature ejaculation is relative How long do you last Is this a personal concern or has your partner also complained 
When did this start and can you think of any significant event that surrounded the time it started Are there any particular stressors in your life presently Does this also occur whenif you masturbate Are you on any medications  

Without answers to these question Im unable to tell you the exact reason why you might be experiencing this however some changes to your sexual routine that may prove helpful are  some men have being able to delay ejaculation when they masturbate within an hour before intercourse while some completely avoided sex temporarily thus relieving the associated sexual pressures The startandstop methods whereby you stop sex when you are close to ejaculation and only continue when you have regained control the squeeze method pelvic floor exercises and use of desensitising condoms are also practices that might help

Cheers

Question: I wake up and 5 minutes later I am hungry Please Id like to have suggestions for dark chocolate low on sugar that I can ingest early in the morning my maternal side of the family have history of diabetes Thank you
Answer:
Hi 

To reduce your risk of diabetes you need to understand the risk and subsequently makes changes to your lifestyle Lifestyle modification isnt easy but its definitely worth the effort 

Some tips include


1 See your doctor for regular checkups As you get older its a good idea to regularly check your blood glucose blood pressure and blood cholesterol levels
2 Manage your weight Increased body fat especially around the abdomen can worsen your risk 
3 Exercise regularly Physical activity on helps manage weight reduce blood glucose levels and may improve blood pressure and cholesterol
4 Eat a balanced healthy diet Reduce the amount of fat in your diet eat more fruit vegetables and highfibre foods Reduce salt intake Reduce fastfood they are usually high in salt fat and kilojoules Its best to cook for yourself using fresh ingredients whenever possible
5 Limit your alcohol intake Too much alcohol leads to weight gain and may increase your blood pressure
6 Quit smoking Smokers are twice as likely to develop diabetes as nonsmokers
7 Control your blood pressure Know your numbers 

Cheers

Therapists are available on the platform if required

Question: Can Edd gives you an exact conception date So one can be sure of a child paternity I am really worried
Answer:
Hi there
EDD expected delivery date can only give you an approximate due date counting from the first day of your last menstrual period It can not give you a conception date EGA estimated gestational age on the other hand can roughly give you the age of the fetus also counting from the first day of your last menstrual period An ultrasound scan done early in the first trimester before 10weeks is usually the most accurate in dating a pregnancy
Confirming the paternity of a baby is best done via DNA test

Question: A friend of mine is having virginal cyst what actually leads to it and how can it be cured
Answer:
Hello there and thanks for using Wellvis
Youve done a good job trying to clarify what is going on with your friend 
Cysts in general are growths in the body that may contain fluid air or other substances They usually are benign that is do not lead to cancer
In the vagina these can be from birth trauma to the vagina surgery child birth or obstructions of glands There are usually no symptoms associated with cysts other than the presence of the lump which may be uncomfortable Sometimes there may be pain while bathing or even during sexual intercourse The substance inside the cyst may become infected and develop into pus In some cases they may be cancerous though rare 
Most of these cysts do not require any treatment unless there is an increase in size it is disturbing daily activities or there is a chance of it being cancerous The most common treatment is surgery to remove the cyst and treatment of infections if any
My recommendation will be for your friend to visit a gynaecologist to confirm the presence of cyst and to assess whether there is any need for an intervention
You could get a head start with seeking direct assistance from one of our verified doctors here by using the CHAT function below You can also send photos to aid in your explanation if you wish We also offer a referral service to assist you in getting the best care you and your friend deserve
Please feel free to ask more questions and I hope this helps

Question: Whats the cure for urinary tract infection most times I feel much pain in passing urine
Answer:
Painful urination is a common sign of a UTI which might occur due to a bacterial infection or inflammation of the urinary tract

Generally women are more likely to develop UTIs than men because they have shorter urethra meaning that microbes have a shorter distance to travel to reach the bladder Women who are pregnant or menopausal also have an increased risk of developing urinary tract infections

Other causes of painful urination depending on your gender includes 
prostatitis  inflammation of the prostate gland
sexually transmitted infection STIs such as genital herpes gonorrhea or chlamydia
kidney stones have also been known to cause painful urination 

It is important to know what the exact cause is And then specific medication and preventive measures can be provided 

You can speak privately to one of the doctors on the platform for more clarification and direction 

Cheers

Question: What are the causes of irregular heart beats
Answer:
Irregular heartbeat is known as arrhythmia and may be caused by many different factors such as

underlying heart diseases electrolyte imbalances changes in the heart muscle
Irregular heart rhythms can also occur in normal healthy hearts

exercise stress smoking use of marijuana alcohol or some medications can also result in irregular heartbeats 

However it is important to know whether you sense these irregularities often and regularly or just once in a while Do they come after particular instances or just casually and all of a sudden 

If you have or feel the following symptoms continuously please contact your doctor for a check up palpitations a feeling of skipped heart beats pounding in the chest dizziness or feeling lightheaded fainting shortness of breath chest discomfort or generalised weakness or feeling very tired 

Treatment depends on the type and seriousness of your arrhythmia Some people with arrhythmias require no treatment For others treatments can include medication making lifestyle changes and undergoing surgical procedures

Cheers

Question:
I had an emergency CS one year ago cos I was pregnant with twin
 but lost one during pregnancy I didnt do family planning because it took me sometime to conceive the first time I have been using withdrawal method and calculating my circle but I got it wrong Im pregnant now Do I have a hope of VBAC
Answer:
Hello Anonymous Im really sorry about your loss and congratulations on conceiving again 
There are a number of requirements before one qualifies for a VBAC First of all the reason for the first CS should not be a recurrent one For instance if the reason for the first CS was a small pelvis theres no point trying for a VBAC 
The duration between the date of your last CS and the date of conception of this pregnancy should not be less than 15 months because this increases the risk of a ruptured uterus 
Following your CS if there was any infection of the womb or of the wound it reduces the quality of the CS scar and a repeat CS would be advisable 
At 36 weeks of pregnancy your doctor will ask you to do a scan to measure babys weight and thickness of the CS Scar An Xray or CT Scan of the pelvis will also be done to see if it is adequate If all these parameters are okay you can then be scheduled for a VBAC 
It is important to note that in most centers you will be given a grace till 41weeks and 3 days to come in natural labor because induction of labor is not done routinely in women with previous CS 
I hope this helps

Question:
I had an emergency CS one year ago cos I was pregnant with twin
 but lost one during pregnancy I didnt do family planning because it took me sometime to conceive the first time I have been using withdrawal method and calculating my circle but I got it wrong Im pregnant now Do I have a hope of VBAC
Answer:
Congratulations for the gift of God on the way 

First thing I would advise you do is get a good Obstetrician to manage this pregnancy 

There are so many reasons surrounding the successful delivery after Caeserian section 
what was the reason for the first emergency CS was the leading twin breech a preterm contraction preterm rupture of membrane or a planned CS due to it being a precious baby as you have said If none of the reasons are recurring and theres no cause for you to have CS this time around then you have a chance of going for VBAC

Also the timing for VBAC also depends on many factors 
If your last delivery is a year ago and you are just pregnant now meaning youve got about 2021 months to the time of delivery you can go for a trial of VBAC if your Obstetrician agrees to it I hope this helps Congratulations once again

Question: Is face mask compulsory now
Answer:

I guess you are referring to the use of face masks during this COVID19 pandemic 
Face masks can be worn if
 You are coughing or sneezing
 You are taking care if anyone whos suspected to have the COVID19 infection

Face masks are not necessary if
 You are a healthy person with no respiratory symptoms like coughing or sneezing
 You are not in contact with or exposed to a suspected case of COVID19

 Know how to wear it properly and how to dispose of it

I hope this helps and stay safe

Question: I have treated stomach ulcer and its  gone for some time now But recently I begin to feel headache stomach ache and heartburn Even fact I  have been sneezing since afternoon
Answer:
Hi

Im sorry about the symptoms youre experiencing While managing it previously did you complete taking your medications Do you get relieved of the pain after eating Are you a smoker Are you conscious of your diet 

Certain factors can exacerbate peptic ulcer or prevent them from healing Taking painkillers like diclofenac and ibuprofen are known to worsen ulcer Drinks containing alcohol caffeine milk orange juices and red pepper should be avoided in an ulcer patient 

Also eat at least two hours before going to bed and take small frequent meals rather than large meals 
Include fruits and vegetables in your diet avoid stress drink enough water get enough sleep and dont smoke 

Kindly note that after taking all these preventive measures and your symptoms persist you should see your doctor 

Hope this helps Cheers

Question: Have been to clinic to complained about a hole in my tooth and I was told not to remove it by I should come for fill but the pains is unbearable cause diclofenac am using is not supressing it any more and it affecting my earpls what drugs do you suggest cause I dont think they will attend to me on my appointment day cause if covid19
Answer:
Hello there 
Firstly  dentists really do not like to take out a tooth that can be saved
Secondly Its actually for your safety that youve been told to return for the filling
At this stage from the little history Ive gathered youll  most likely need  a somewhat complex  treatment to fix the issue

 Nowbecause of the Corona Pandemic  dentists are being careful to drill a tooth and carry out elective procedures 
 because we are at the forefront we deal with aerosols and this can help spread droplets  leading to infection of the patient and even the dentist Nurse  However  dental emergencies such as yours are being attended to 
So you could go back to the clinic or check somewhere else and ask for a temporary  filling that wont  require drilling to give some form of relief
Medications may not help so much  until the problem  is sorted Then meds will be given 

Ethically wise in medicine Im  not allowed to prescribe  any meds without physical contact with the patient so my best advise still remains that you go back to that clinic or check another clinic thats  still open 

I hope this helps and that you take  action fast so you can feel better soon

Kind regards
Dr Oluwayemisi  Ikumelo
Dental Surgeon

Question: Can AS marry AS
Answer: Certainly an AS can marry an AS However at every conception there is a 1 in  4 risk of having a biological child who is will carry the SS bloody type Can you avoid this Certainly yes If you are interested in having a biological child then you need to consult a gynecologist Its possible to conduct external fertilization of the egg with the sperm  check the genotype of the early embryo  and if this is not SS then implant into the uterus This can be quite expensive but is possible The other option is of course to adopt a child Whichever option you decide as a couple I wish you the very best of luck

Question: Please is black seed good for the body and what are the side effects
Answer:
Hi good morning 
Blackheads form when a clog or plug develops in the opening of hair follicles in your skin Each follicle contains one hair and a sebaceous gland that produces oil This oil called sebum helps keep your skin soft Dead skin cells and oils collect in the opening to the skin follicle producing a bump called a comedo

Question: Please is black seed good for the body and what are the side effects
Answer:
Some factors can increase your chances of developing acne and blackheads including
producing too much body oil
the buildup of the Propionibacterium acnes bacteria on the skin
irritation of the hair follicles when dead skins cells dont shed on a regular basis
undergoing hormonal changes that cause an increase in oil production during the teen years during menstruation or while taking birth control pills

Question: Am a lady of 20 and i have never had sexual intercourse before but recently i was sexually excited and i sticked a brush handle in my vagina an masturbated pls is it possible that my hymen is brokenplss i need answers its against my culture to get married without the hymen being present
Answer:
Hi Anon
First of all it is important to establish a few things with you about the hymen It is a thin piece of tissue that surrounds the vagina not quite covering it as most people believe It might interest you to know that some people are born without a hymen and that the hymen usually gets thinner as you grow

While like you have pointed out some cultures use the presence of the hymen as a determinant for virginity it is important for you to know that simple activities like riding a bicycle or climbing trees can be responsible for hymenal tearing Basically the presence or absence of a hymen does not imply sexual activity
The hymen may bleed when it tears but that does not always happen 

It is understandable that your fears are grounded in your cultural beliefs however it is important to try to engage parentsfamily members with discussions such as why hymenal tearing is not linked to sexual activity Please try to be tactful with this conversation or otherwise avoid it if your parentsguardians may physically assault you

It is also important to when you get in a relationship have this kind of conversation with your partner Please be open about your sexual activity with them too

As you have mentioned that you have never engaged in sexual activity prior to this kindly ensure to use protection ie condoms to keep yourself from sexually transmitted infections

On a final note your religion or culture may frown at masturbation but your personal inclinations might be otherwise In that case please be careful about the kind of objects you use for your pleasure Avoid objects with sharp or pointy ends or not at all made for the purpose of masturbation You can use your fingers but ensure they are clean and your nails are trimmed

Please stay safe in this pandemic
Kind regards

Question: Hiiam an adult and am getting married in two weeks and ive never had sexual intercourse before but last week i was aroused and i sticked my index finger in my vagina and it went in smoothly does it mean that my hymen is tornpls i need answers so i can explain to my fiance coz Ive always wanted him to break my hymen on our wedding night so i want a straight answer if it is broken or not am so stressed right now and i even swore to do it never again
Answer:
Hello thank you for using Wellvis 

Its understandable that you feel stressed now given your hopes regarding your sexuality
A virgin is someone who has never had sexual intercourse however virginity is beginning to mean different things to different people The hymen is a membranous lining found at the vaginal opening it may take different forms and could be absent in some women It can break through various means and may even stretch out over time You may notice some blood at the point when the hymen is broken

Please note that for most the traditional meaning of virginity still obtains which is the absence of penovaginalpenoanal sexual intercourse Going by this you are still a virgin

However while masturbating might not result in a hymen breaking I will advise that you visit a hospital close to you so that your vaginal area can be examined by a nurse or doctor who will check if your hymen is still intact
 
I hope this allays your fears Im also happy to have a private chat with you if you wish
Please accept my warm congratulations on your upcoming wedding

Question:
Gud morning
Pls what is d solution to body odour
Answer:
Hello thank you for using Wellvis
Body odour occurs from the action of part of the bodys normal flora on sweat Body odour is common and may be associated with excessive sweating Things that can make body odour worse include poor personal hygiene exercise hot weather being overweight hormonal changes certain medications and the presence of medical conditions like diabetes liver and kidney disease

Some tips include the following 
Have your bathe at least twice daily increase the frequency if you have been involved in particularly rigorous activity 
Pay attention to your armpit groin and feet and be sure to toweldry thoroughly Take a shower after exercising 
Shave your armpit regularly 
Change and wash your clothes regularly 
Reduce intake of certain foods that have strong smells like garlic onion curry as their intake might increase body odour that results from some of your sweat glands Also reduce the intake of caffeine and alcoholcontaining drinks as they might contribute to body odour
Maintain a healthy weight for your height 
Use deodorants
You will need to visit a hospital if the symptoms dont resolve despite doing all the above if you notice a change in how it usually smells or if you suddenly begin to sweat much more than usual
Again thank you for using Wellvis and please use the chat with a doctor option if you have further questions

Question: DoctorI have lower back pain for one year nowI have done xtray twice and the doctor said the xtray is okI was given pain drugs but the pain still continue
Answer:
Hello 

This sounds like a case of chronic back pain The history and physical examination are the first step in the evaluation and management of low back pain therefore you might have to see an orthopaedic surgeon andor a physiotherapist to rule out serious conditions 

Meanwhile you can keep your back healthy and strong by engaging in regular lowimpact exercises that dont strain your back It can increase strength and endurance in your back and allow your muscles to function better Walking and swimming are good choices this also allows you to build abdominal and back muscles which strengthen your core to serve as a natural corset for your back
You must also maintain a healthy weight as being overweight strains back muscles If youre overweight trimming down can prevent back pain
Quit smoking if you presently smoke 

Standing sitting and lifting heavy object in a more backprotective way will go a long way towards protecting your back 

For more immediate and personalised health advice you can use the chat option to talk to one of the verified doctors online  

Cheers

Question: During sex many years ago I had a frenulum cut It healed after a while but kept opening whenever I have sex What do I do
Answer:
Hello there and thanks for using Wellvis

Sorry about what you are experiencing and I hope I can provide some good counsel

What you have described sounds like a posterior fourchette frenulum injury which could likely be a fissure or tear Just as you described it can result from sexual intercourse and in some instances inflammation or infection Though this tends to resolve after some time as you mentioned it can be recurrent too like your case 

My recommendation will be halting sexual intercourse to allow some healing and while you do that visit a gynaecologist to examine the affected area A decision on what is the right treatment can then be done It could require surgical repair or not depending on the extent of the damage

If and when you return to sexual intercourse I will recommend that you and your partner discuss about this so that you both enjoy the experience His thrustings should be gentle and not vigorous Also consider assuming positions that do not make penetration challenging Using lubricants can also offer some benefits

If you will love to chat directly with one of our doctors kindly use the chat button below and you will be connected to one of us at a very affordable fee We will be glad to give you the best help

I hope this helps and wishing you a speedy recovery

PS Just a reminder that you should continue to practice social distancing and hand washing during these times of COVID19 and stay safe

Question:
Hi good afternoon
Please ive been having severe headache since the last 3days and I recently discovered its usually triggered by rays of light entering into my eyes sun or any kind of light actually I this thats why the headache almost never stopped Please what can be done
Answer:
Im sorry Mr Olayiwola for your symptoms What you actually have is glare 
Glare is the loss of visual discomfort or performance which occurs when the intensity of light in the visual field intensity of light entering the eyes is greater than the intensity of light to which the eyes are adapted Simply put glare occurs when too much light enters your eye and interferes with your eyes ability to manage it 
Common eye problems that can cause glare include
 Recent corrective eye surgery like cataract surgery
Refractive eye diseases such as
Nearsightedness difficulty seeing things far away
Farsightedness trouble perceiving things nearby
Presbyopia difficulty reading small prints due to aging
Astigmatism blurry vision due to the irregular shape of the eye

If the history of recent eye surgery is ruled you may be having one or more of these refractive errors mentioned above So you will require better than just dark glasses  You will need a medicated glasses with photochromic lenses withwithout antireflex
I will suggest you book an appointment with a nearby ophthalmologist for proper examination and prompt treatment

I wish you all the best

Question: Please I have a vaginal discharge thats off white in color and itchy with an odd smell how can I treat it
Answer:
Hello

Thank you for using Wellvis

Vaginal discharge may be normal or abnormal

Normal causes of vaginal discharge include pregnancy ovulation exercise etc The abnormal causes could be by bacteria yeast and other organisms pathogens Cancer of the cervix opening of the womb may also cause vaginal discharge 

This means that no vaginal discharge should be taken to be ordinary until the doctor says so

Each cause of vaginal discharge can be differentiated by its distinctive colour or smell A note of its consistency should also be noted

However the description you gave of the vaginal discharge with respect to its colour and odour shows it is most likely an abnormal vaginal discharge

More details about the discharge is therefore required from you 

This would aid in identifying the cause and the appropriate treatment to apply

All the best

Question: What can l use to tighten up my Vaginal
Answer:
Hi
Welcome to Wellvis 

This question is a very common one by young women most especially after childbirth They are usually bothered about reduced sexual satisfaction for them and their partner

There are different ways of tightening the vagina but it is worthy of note that drugs and herbal extracts being advertised everywhere for vaginal tightening does not have a scientific basis for its cure but may even cause more damage to the body

The most reliable remedy for vaginal tightening is Kegels exercises

Kegels are actually effective for toning the pelvic floor decreasing incontinence and improving sexual satisfaction

Kegel exercises involve tightening the muscles of your pelvic floor in several sets of repetitions throughout the day 

These are the same muscles you would use to stop urine flow If you do Kegels you will improve the strength and tone of your pelvic floor whether or not you take vaginal tightening pills 

Finally there are surgical procedures to improve vagina tightness but these are usually used as the last resort

Hope this helps

Question: I have a big lemon plus sweet sized and red haemorrhoid by my anus A bit painful Any advice
Answer:
Hello there and thanks for using Wellvis

Sorry about what you are experiencing

How long have you had this for How often do you pass stool Are you experiencing any bleeding when passing stool What is the consistency of your stool Do you have to strain when passing stool Do you sit on the toilet for too long

Haemorrhoids are usually easy to manage at home However you should visit the doctor if it starts bleeding you notice changes in your stool colour and consistency as well as other symptoms like dizziness which may be linked to blood loss from the bleeding haemorrhoid

Some lifestyle modifications will be
 Eating high fibre foods like fruits which will make passage of stool easier and reduce your chances of being constipated this will also help avoid straining
 Exercising or being active helps with bowel movements and thus reduces the chances of constipation
 Drink a lot of water and fluids
 Avoid sitting in the toilet for long as this puts pressure on the veins responsible for forming haemorrhoids Maybe try avoiding the use of your mobile phone while you are using the toilet as this is a common reason for prolonged toilet use
 Avoid lifting heavy weights

For treatment
 Immerse your anal region in warm water for 1015 minutes two to three times a day using sitz bath bath tub or a large basin depending on what is available
 Some creams or ointments like Anusol can offer some relief
 You can take oral painkillers But remember to see your doctor as the pain worsens

You should be able to experience some relief and improvement of symptoms with these recommendations

You can continue this discussion by using the chat function below and one of our doctors will be available to have a live feedback

Hope this helps and wish you the best

Question: I am 6weeks 5days pregnant and the Doctor said he can see the gestation sac but there was no baby in it Do i have complications
Answer:
Hello
Congratulations on your pregnancy What is visualized in a pregnancy scan depends among other things on the type of ultrasound done A transvaginal scan TVS is done through the vagina and is usually able to have a closer look at pelvic structures as is seen during a early pregnancy A transabdominal scan TAS is done by placing the ultrasound probe on the abdomen to view structures In order to help get a better view of pelvic structures in transabdominal scan you may be asked to have a full bladder drink lots of water get pressed but do not urinate

In a transvaginal scan it is possible to see a yolk sac within the gestational at about 5 and a half weeks while it may be around 7 weeks for a transabdominal scan So again it will be important to know the type of scan that you had done

Again because most of the estimates are also based statistics it is important to note that one can not be hard and fast on these dates
My suggestion will be that you consider repeating an ultrasound in about 2 weeks from the previous 

In the meantime it will be good to ensure you are registered in a facility that can provide you with optimum antenatal services Should you notice any bleed do not hesitate to present to your primary care provider We will also be glad to answer any other questions or concerns you may have

I hope you found these few lines helpful Should you need more information do not hesitate to use the private chat option to speak with a doctor of your choice 
Wishing you and your baby a healthy development

Question: I am 6weeks 5days pregnant and the Doctor said he can see the gestation sac but there was no baby in it Do i have complications
Answer:
Hi good afternoon 
You must be really worried However I dont think there is a problem or you have a complication of any kind Normally following conception the babys growth is in stagesyou said you are 6weeks and 5days gone what was seen during the ultrasound scan was the embryonic sac with probably what is called the foetal pole thats like a very early stage of your babys growth  You need not worry if you have no other complaints however you can visit another facility for a repeat ultrasound but I will advice you wait for some time maybe a week or two and then repeat the ultrasound scan 

I hope this helps

Question: Please I have a male and I have urinary tract infection please what can I do to stop this immediately
Answer:
Hello

Thank you for using Wellvis Urinary tract infections UTIs are broadly classified into upper tract and lower tract UTIs The lower tract involves the bladder and the urethra while the upper tract involves the kidneys and ureters Treatment options and duration differ based on the specific type of UTI A few more specific questions can help tease out the type you may have

It is also important not just to treat a urinary tract infection but to also endeavour to know what predisposed the person to it in order to prevent future recurrences 

Women are generally more easily predisposed to UTIs because the urethra in women is relatively short Some of the factors that may predispose men to UTIs include poor urine outflow from prostate enlargement or urethral strictures urinary tract stones or sexually transmitted infections

Please consider a private chat to any of the doctors on this platform to see how we can specifically be of help to you

Cheers

Question: How effective is Keto Diet in weight loss
Answer:
Hello
Thank you for your question A ketogenic diet keto diet for short is a low carbohydrate high fat fat diet Normally the body uses carbohydrate as fuel for energy When the body is deprived of carbohydrate it is forced to burn fat as fuel and in the process release ketone bodies which the cells now use for energy Because fat is being burned as the primary source of fuel this diet promotes weight loss

Keto diet was originally developed to help with children with seizure disorders close to a century ago It has been thought to be helpful in a number of other health conditions but more research is still needed to ascertain these
However it is also important to realize that it is not without its side effects The ketone bodies have a tendency to make the body more acidic acidosis There is also a risk of development of kidney stones Other possible side effects are fatigue headache low blood sugar indigestion etc

So if you are considering starting a ketogenic diet please discuss with your doctor first especially if you have any underlying health condition It will also be helpful that you undergo this under the guidance of a registered dietitian

It is important to realize that while loosing weight is important for your health you should also do it a way that promotes your overall well being

Should you want further counselling on weight loss please consider the private chat option with any of our doctors

Question: Pls I have this illness  something like a boil within my buttock   and its always swell up and gather  pus and during that I felt so much pain  And when d pus is drain I feel more relief  I did a test sometimes back the result was staphylococcus  infection but have been using drug   took the injection when I went to complain to a doctor but still the boil keep coming  Pls what can I do to cure this
Answer:
Hello
while it is possible to recurrent boils in the anal region what you have described sounds a bit more like a condition called fistulainano or anal fistula In anal fistulas there is usually a tunnel that opens on two sides one near skin and another near the end of your bowel Often times people notice only the outer opening but are unable to see the one that is deeper within anus Because it is a tunnel with 2  openings no amount of antibiotics will likely close it Usually one will require treatment that will close up the tunnel or open it up and allow it to heal

It will be advisable that you visit your hospital and you may be required to be examined by a general surgeon for the best option of advice However please visit your primary care provider so that you can be properly examined

I hope this information comes helpful

Question:
My mum has been having problems with her sleep intermittently over couple of years back At some point I was beginning to make conclusions that it is spiritual but I have the intuition that it is not For instance in a whole year she would battle with the sleeping difficulty for like three weeks to a month probably by December or in the midmonth of the year Anytime this happens it has always made her feel terribly sick She has taken several sleeping tablets and countless medical checkups over the previous years whenever this popup At some point the tablets made her feel weak some other time the tablets is not working anymore as she will still not be able to sleep after taking the tablets
And now its popup again another fresh time in the year she took sleeping medications the day after day but it has no effect Few days ago her illness aggravated We recently discovered shes hypertensive after she was rushed to the hospital Please I need medical tips and advice to sought this out now and forever Sleep difficulty has been the issue right from the inception Can you feel my grief Panacea please
Answer:
Hello 

Thank you for using Wellvis 

The issue of sleep disorders in the elderly is very broad as causes vary significantly Understanding the exact cause can sometimes be time consuming but the results are always worth it 

Considering it is a long standing issue as stated by you it is important that she gets a general health review preferably from a physician or a geriatrician which will include understanding her medical history concomitant medications she may be on physical examination lab tests etc A mental status examination will also be required to rule out underlying psychological stress or disorders following retirement existing health problems death of loved ones etc 

Also she might be required to keep a sleep diary and a sleep study may be requested 

Overall it is important that the underlying issue be identified as soon as possible and any accompanying illness be treated or managed Over the counter sleep medications can become abused or not work as before once tolerance is built and most importantly can have adverse effect when used with some other medications 

Pending her review with a family physician some helpful tips include 
limiting liquid before bed avoiding caffeine and alcohol eating three to four hours before bedtime light exercising regularly taking a warm bath to relax etc 

Cheers

Question: My 15 year old boy had haircut shaved at home about two weeks ago He told me last night that his head was itching and makes him very restless We applied home remedy baking soda paste He was relieved until now that he is very restless again
Answer:
Hello there and thanks for using Wellvis 

I empathise with what your son is going through and hopefully my response here offers some help

Did he use a common blade at the barbers shop Is this the first time its happening Have you noticed any bumps on his head

What you have described sounds like folliculitis sometimes called Barbers itch It is an infection of the hair follicles usually from poorly sterilised shaving equipment The infection could be from bacteria fungi or viruses in some cases It normally resolves in about two weeks with just home management However if poorly treated could have complications

Ill recommend you wash his head and put a warm moist cloth or towel over it after that Depending on the causative organism you can apply an antibacterial or antifungal cream or ointment

To prevent this from recurring consider purchasing hair clippers for his personal use If this cannot be done ensure that the barber cleans and sterilises his machine properly before using on his head

You can use the chat function below and get in touch with one of our doctors With the chat you can take photos of the hair and scalp and send to give a clear idea of what is going on

I hope this helps and speedy recovery to your boy

Question: Please I have been feeling numbness and tingling in my hands and feet for two years now when I got pregnant with my second child I have tried my possible best but still any help please
Answer:
Hello Philomena 

The feeling of numbness and tingling in the hands and legs is known as paresthesia and because its been going on for about two years this is considered chronic paresthesia which is often a sign of nerve damage peripheral neuropathy 

There are different causes of peripheral neuropathy diabetes kidney disease infections poisoning etc are some of the known causes 

The severity and frequency of the paresthesia depends on the cause therefore it is important to find the exact cause oftentimes treating the underlying cause eliminates the continuous numbness and tingling sensation The earlier the underlying cause is identified and management commenced the less likely potentially lifelong consequences can develop 

Kindly visit your physician for a review and possible investigations in an attempt to identify the cause Meanwhile you can chat with a doctor privately here to discuss your other symptoms and to get information and advice on how to proceed 

Cheers

  The victim should report to the police station so that the chase for the perpetrator is initiated 

 Visit thé hospital for examination of the genital and anal areas to document any signs of forced entry Here also a screen for sexually transmitted infections needs to be done

Thanks for your question

Kindly note that that no matter what you have heard read or previously known Andrew Livers salt is not effective or useful and will never be useful for emergency contraception as that is not what the manufacturers intended it be used for

It is a misconception that Andrews Liver salt can prevent pregnancy

You can wait a few days to see if your regular menstrual flow comes It may be a bit delayed because youre worried and anxious
If the flow does not come in a week Please book a chat to speak with a doctor to discuss your concerns
Be Safe

Question: Pls how can I identify my fertility period when my menstruation is not coming at the same interval of time
Answer:
If your average menstrual cycle is 28 days you ovulate around day 14 and your most fertile days are days 12 13 and 14
If your average menstrual cycle is 35 days ovulation happens around day 21 and your most fertile days are days 1920 and 21

Your fertile period which is also known as ovulation period can be identified by the following signs
Common Signs that Occur in Most Women
 Change in cervical fluid  the Cervical fluid that resembles egg whites is a sign you are near ovulation or are ovulating 
 Change in basal body temperature  Your body temperature suddenly rises around the period Tracking your basal body temperature accurately over a few months can help you predict fertile period
 Breast tenderness
 Abdominal bloating
 Increased sex drive
 A heightened sense of smell taste or vision

You can also go online and use a web based ovulator calculator

Regards

Question: Can chronic halitosis be cured permarnently
Answer:
Hello there
Also known as mouth odorhalitosis could be an embarassing condition to the sufferer and the diagnosis can be quite tricky to the dentistIt can be classified into True halitosis  and Psychogenic halitosisfalse halitosis in which the person just feels he has mouth odor even when nobody has ever told him his mouth was smelling
Having said thatthere are  a couple of likely causes of true halitosis and these determine the chronicity of the conditionSome of the possible causes include
1Poor oral hygieneA heavy presence of plaque and calculusyellowish to dark colored deposits on the teeth in the mouth will cause mouth odorAlso nonbrushing or improper brushing of the tongue is a major cause of halitosisThe tongue is the largest reservoir of food debris in the mouth hence not brushing the tongue is like not brushing at all
2Diets Frequent concsumption of onionsgarlicbeans and other food which produce Volatile sulphur compoundsVSCThese VSCs play a major role in dietasociated halitosis
3Systemic diseases like Chronic Kidney diseaseGastroesophageal reflux disordersGERD can also cause halitosis
Alsohalitosis is associated with eating disorders like Bulimia nervosa where people engage in acts of  intentionally inducing vomitting of food ingestedBesides some people engage in the habit of regurgitating ingested food and this could also lead to mouth odor

Based on all I  have stated abovethe best way to diagnose halitosis would be for you to visit a dentistThe dentist will have to examine your mouth thoroughly and evaluate the possible causes of the halitosis in your case
Have you ever had scaling and polishing  It is very possible the chronic halitosis in your case is because you have never visited the dentistScaling and polishing is a procedure which is meant to be done every six months  at leastand this is a way to clear the cobwebs in our mouthsthe plaque and calculus which I mentioned earlier
Best regards

Question: Can chronic halitosis be cured permarnently
Answer: And YES halitosis is permanently curable

Question: Pls how can a 20years old stop bedwetting
Answer:
Hi
Im going to ask you some follow up questions to have a better understanding of whats going on
Have they ever been bed wetting or did they have a period of dryness then began to bedwet again Are they on medication for any condition During the day do they contain themselves well
Its important to see a doctor so as to have them examined and if need be run some tests to exclude the possibility of infections and other underlying conditions that might lead to the bedwetting 
Meanwhile keep an otimistic attitude and motivate them Dont let them feel bad about it or punish them
Encourage them to void when they wake up every few hours say 2hrs and discourage them from holding urine to the last minute 
They should drink just enough fluids throughout the day so as to maintain adequate hydration as well as not feel thirsty in the evening which could lead them to drink excessive amounts before bed and bedwetting
Take them to the washroom before bedtime If after 3 months these measures dont result in dryness medication or using an alarm at night will help
Thanks

Question: My baby of 1yr 3monthd has a squint The opthamologist we saw has been checking him doing tests but hasnt given him any drug or eye drop Can squint be treated
Answer:
Hello there
Sorry about baby It was a good call to have him reviewed by an ophalmologist as the treatment will depend on what is discovered during the assessment of the affected eyes as well as tests done
If the squint is of sudden onset it could point to causes like a recent disease process eg infections A longstanding squint could be as a result of eg developmental abnormalities of the eye muscles and its nerves or diseases that weaken the eye muscles among others
The ophthalmologist therefore has to assess the babys vision to see if its reduced or not his eye movements to assess the strength of the eye muscles and to even check the inside of the eye by use of an instrument
Now the treatment will depend on whats discovered If there is an underlying disease causing the squint whether inside the eye or not it is the disease that will be treated If he has decreased vision in the affected eyes that will be corrected too There is also role for surgery which aims to improve cosmetic appearance and to tighten or loosen the eye muscles 
Hope this helps

Meanwhile ensure that you keep the eye clean wash your hands regularly and try not to touch your eyes and face 

Cheers

Genital infections including yeast needs to be treated by a medical Doctor to prevent reccurence The symptoms you are still experiencing shows that you still have genital infection You will need to see a medical Doctor in the town you live for laboratory culture of your discharges some blood tests and other medical evaluation and treatment Your sexual partner will also need to be treated in order to avoid reinfection during sexual intercourse If you are unmarried yet l advice that you practice abstinence from sex this way healing will be enhanced and complications such as Pelvic inflammatory disease ectopic pregnancy and blockage of the fallopian tubes that are attached to the womb and other complications can be prevented

Question: I got white discharge every day since when I was young and after my period within 7days I have bloody discharge and sometimes I get boil on my genital area
Answer: It is normal to have a white or clear vaginal secretion These secretions are produced by the glands in the vagina and neck of the womb know as the cervix These secretions are designed to keep the vagina clean and  to prevent infections  this is why you have been experiencing it as a young girl If you experience brownish blood stains few days after your menses this is referred to as stale blood reminant of your menstrual blood but if what you are  experiencing  is pure red vaginal bleeding then you need to see a medical Doctor in the town you live for medical evaluation  and treatment You may experience boil if you use a razor blade or shaving stick to  shave off your pubic hair and you sustain a cut that gives a microorganism a space to penetrate through thereby causing infection such as boil Try and improve on your genital hygiene feed well by increasing your protein intake in order to boost up your immunity to prevent boils in your genital area or otherwise Kindly see a Doctor for advice and treatment if you are currently having boils in your genital area Thank you

Question: Ive been experiencing severe pains around my waist for over 2 months now and I dont know what might have been the cause What should I do
Answer:
Hi Jesse 

How old are you How would you describe this pain burning sensation or throbbing Is it more on your lower back or on your flanks the sides Do you feel pain when you touch your waist Is there any history of trauma or fall or an attempt to lift a heavy object prior to the pain Any associated pain to other parts of your body eg legs Any associated feeling of numbness cramping spasms or weakness in your waist legs or other body parts Any history of fever weight loss or problems urinating or going to the toilet prior to the pain immediately it started or presently 

Low back pain waist pain have varying causes most often musculoskeletal issues which arise from poor posture and improper lifting of heavy objects while sometimes its something much more serious Meanwhile over the counter medications for pain muscle relaxants and slowlight stretching and massage has been known to relieve symptoms and help with pain management 

You can have a private chat with a doctor here to provide answers to these questions and get advice on how to manage the pain and what to do next 

Cheers

Question: What could be the cause of frequent throat pain and difficulty in breathing in an adult especially after eating
Answer:
Hello 

Based on your complaints and how common this complaints are I believe what your are experiencing is heartburn which is caused by acidic stomach contents coming back up towards the throat acid reflux It is often accompanied by an unpleasant sour taste in the mouth 

Lots of people get heartburn from time to time and sometimes theres no obvious reason why
However it has been shown that certain foods or activities worsen it 
such as coffee alcohol chocolate beans and fatty or spicy foods being overweight smoking pregnancy stress and anxiety etc 

You can have a private chat with a doctor here for advice on how to get treatment or better manage it 

Cheers

Question: What to do about premonopausemenopause symptoms
Answer:
Menopause begins in the late 40s or early 50s for most women It usually lasts for a few years 
During this time at least twothirds of women experience symptoms of menopause which include hot flashes night sweats mood swings irritability and tiredness etc
Moreover menopausal women are at a higher risk of several diseases including osteoporosis obesity heart disease and diabetes Most people turn to natural supplements and remedies for relief 
Here are the highlights of some of the measures to reduce the symptoms of menopause
Eat Foods Rich in Calcium and Vitamin D
Achieve and Maintain a Healthy Weight
Eat Lots of Fruit and Vegetables
Avoid Trigger Foods Certain foods such as caffeine alcohol and foods that are sugary or spicy may trigger hot flashes night sweats and mood swings
Exercise Regularly
Eat More Foods That Are High in Phytoestrogens Phytoestrogens are naturally occurring plant compounds that can mimic the effects of estrogen in the body Therefore they may help balance hormones These foods include soybeans and soy products tofu tempeh flaxseeds linseeds sesame seeds and beans
Drink Enough Water
Reduce Refined Sugar and Processed Foods
Dont Skip Meals Eating regular meals may be important when youre going through menopause
Eat ProteinRich Foods Regularly eating protein throughout the day can help prevent the loss of lean muscle mass that occurs with age
Take Natural Supplements Many women take natural products and remedies to relieve their menopause symptoms

Question: What to do about premonopausemenopause symptoms
Answer:
Menopause is not an illness Its a natural part of life
Though its symptoms can be difficult to deal with eating the right diet and exercising regularly may help alleviate and prevent them

Question: Anyone experienced cord around fetal neck during pregnancywhats the best thing to do
Answer:
Hello there and thanks for using Wellvis

It is not uncommon to see babies with their umbilical cord wrapped around their necks It is not as a result of any cause from the mother and usually does not cause any harm during delivery It is sometimes but not always associated with excess amniotic fluid or when there is more than one baby in the womb It is usually loosely wrapped around the neck allowing normal foetal blood flow 

If detected early it is not a cause for concern as long as the baby movements can still be felt throughout the pregnancy During labour the heart rate and vitals of the baby will be monitored as usual to detect any distress and act accordingly If it is a normal delivery with the head coming out first one of things always checked for is if the cord is around the neck This will be removed first before delivering the rest of the babys body

So its important to regular at and report any changes during antenatal visits as well as making sure delivery occurs in a health facility from skilled hands

Feel free to ask more questions to any of our doctors using the chat function below related to this or any other health issues We can also assist with referrals if you need to start antenatal

Hope this helps

Question:
Good evening 
During the window period after a possible exposure to HIV will symptoms start showing  or till after 3 months
Answer:
The recommended strategy is to get tested 24 weeks 3 months and 6 months after a risky exposure Using a sensitive antigenantibody HIV test of those who are infected most will test positive at 1 month almost all will test positive at 3 months and the rest will test positive at 6 months

It takes time for the body to develop HIV antibodies after infection Almost all persons develop antibodies within 2 to 12 weeks but it can take up to 6 months after infection A positive result means antibodies to HIV were found in your body This means you have HIV infection

According to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention CDC primary HIV symptoms may show up 2 to 4 weeks after initial exposure Symptoms can continue for up to several weeks However some people may exhibit symptoms only for a few days People with early HIV sometimes dont show any symptoms yet they can still transmit the virus to others

At this early stage HIV usually presents with flulike symptoms Its possible for someone in this stage to think their symptoms are due to severe flu rather than HIV 
Fever is the most common symptom Others include headaches sore throat excessive fatigue chills muscle pain swollen lymph nodes maculopapular truncal rash

Question: Pls how can I stop running stomach
Answer:
Hi Chima and thanks for using Wellvis

I am assuming by running stomach you mean diarrhoea as my reply will be under this assumption

The treatment of diarrhoea depends on the age of the person affected the nature of the stool being passed the possible cause and other factors In majority of cases the diarrhoea resolves on its own within a few days without any intervention or treatment

The main aim of treatment is to replenish the electrolytes and fluids being lost by taking water rehydration solutions soup but be wary of fruit juice as they can worsen diarrhoea In severe cases it may require an IV drip at a health facility

If the cause is infectious bacteria or parasites antibiotics can be taken to treat any infections Signs like blood in stool are pointers towards a possible infection However note that some antibiotics may in fact cause or worsen diarrhoea so ensure you only take an antibiotic prescribed by a doctor

Other underlying conditions need to be treated Consult with your doctor if you are having recurrent episodes of diarrhoea

Avoiding possible triggers or causes like dairy spicy foods sugary foods foods high in fats and fibre etc can help prevent onset or worsening of the diarrhoea

Only take antidiarrhoeal medications when prescribed by you are sure the cause of diarrhoea is not infectious These medications should not be given to children

You can also chat with one of our doctors using the chat function below and a more tailored answer as well as recommendations will be given to you

I hope this helps

Question: What is the solution for someone having premature ejaculation and a low sperm count
Answer:
Premature ejaculation occurs when there is an inability to delay ejaculation for more than one minute after penetration It could be
Lifelong primary Lifelong premature ejaculation occurs all or nearly all of the time beginning with your first sexual encounters
Acquired secondary Acquired premature ejaculation develops after youve had previous sexual experiences without ejaculatory problems

Many men feel that they have symptoms of premature ejaculation but the symptoms dont meet the diagnostic criteria for premature ejaculation Hence it might be a natural variability of premature ejaculation which includes periods of rapid ejaculation as well as periods of normal ejaculation

The exact cause of premature ejaculation isnt known It was once thought to be only psychological but studies have shown that it involves a complex interaction of psychological and biological factors
Psychological causes includes early sexual experiences sexual abuse poor body image depression worrying about premature ejaculation guilty feelings that increase your tendency to rush through sexual encounters
Other factors includes erectile dysfunction anxiety relationship problems
Biological causes abnormal hormone levels abnormal levels of brain chemicals called neurotransmitters inflammation and infection of the prostate or urethra inherited traits
There are some stressors risk factors that can increase your risk of premature ejaculation These are erectile dysfunction and stressin form of mental or emotional stressors in any area of your life

You need to book an appointment with specialists Urologist clinical psychologist Some men do feel embarrassed discussing their sexual health concerns but dont let that keep you from talking to a doctor Premature ejaculation is a common and treatable problem

However theres self treatment you may want totry
Use of idocaine spray
Practice of stopping intercourse before ejaculation and then resume again

Question: My doctor told me that my tubes are blocked pls what can I do
Answer:
Hello 

Fallopian tubes connect the ovaries and the uterus and every month during ovulation the egg travels from the ovaries to the uterus via the tubes Therefore once these tubes are blocked the chances of pregnancy are slimmer 

The most common cause of blocked fallopian tubes is PID others include 	previous ectopic pregnancy endometriosis etc Also tubes can be blocked due to tubal ligation a procedure whereby tubes are medically tied 

Blocked tubes are usually diagnosed with a specialized xray called a hysterosalpingogram HSG 

Treatment options vary and are dependent on the degree of blockage or if both tubes are affected Options include surgery IVF or reversal of ligation depending on the results of examinations

Question: Is it safe to wear nonmedicated glasses to look at screens ie computers phonesTv
Answer:
Hello 

To the best of my knowledge non prescribed glasses have no particular effect on screens However staring at a computer screen all day can result in eyestrain tired eyes and generalised fatigue It is important to adjust lighting when youre working on a computer it is also important that you rest your eyes often to lessen eye fatigue and make conscious efforts to blink regularly so that the eyes stay well lubricated and do not dry out

Cheers

Answer:

 Postinor 2 is a drug that acts as an emergency contraceptive if taken within 72 hours of unprotected sex but more effective if taken within the first 24 hours of unprotected sex If you do not take it appropriately you may be pregnant Kindly go to a reputable medical laboratory to do a serum blood hcg test pregnancy testlt is too early to run a pelvic scan it wont reveal significant findings  If it is still negative it may be that you have hormonal imbalance In either case you still need to see a medical Doctor  Thank you
